title: lemuen_(arknights)
body:
A playable Sniper operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Laterano[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]May 21st[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sankta[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]169 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]12 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

First appeared as an NPC during [i]Guide Ahead[/i], she was later introduced as an operator in [i]The Masses' Travels[/i]. She is the [[adoptive siblings|adoptive elder sister]] of [[Exusiai (Arknights)|]] and a former Pontifica Cohors squadmate of [[Mostima (Arknights)|]], [[Fiammetta (Arknights)|]] and [[Andoain (arknights)|]]. Like all Sankta, she has an angel motif.

Due to an incident in the past, she has been in a five-year coma, which makes her unable to walk due to her muscle condition. See [[Andoain (arknights)|]]. She is confined to a [[wheelchair]]. At the time of [i]Hortus de Escapismo[/i], She was regaining mobility thanks to rehabilitation. Following the events of [i]The Masses' Travels[/i], where she was forced to walk for a long time, her condition has worsen again.

She has [[long hair|long,]] [[pink hair]] and [[pink eyes]], a simple white, circular [[halo]], and white [[energy wings]] that strongly resemble her sister's. She carries a small [[character doll]] of Exusiai and a [[sniper rifle]].

Her [[voice actor|voice actresses]] are [[Nakamura Eriko]] (Japanese) & Su Wan (Chinese). Her illustrator is [[IRIS Yi]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #9791675: Default
* !post #9791676: [[lemuen (elite ii) (arknights)|Elite II]]
* !post #9790949: Hospital Gown (Guide Ahead)
* !post #9831533: Pontifica Cohors (Guide Ahead)
* !post #9790951: Cardinal uniform (Hortus de Escapismo)
* !post #9790953: Cardinal uniform (The Masses' Travels)
* !post #9790954: Default (The Masses' Travels)
* !post #9781960: [[lemuen (young) (arknights)|Young]] (The Masses' Travels)

title: small_head
body:
When a character has a noticeably small head in relation to the rest of their body. Also known as Heroic Proportions. Usually caused by the rest of the body being large (a very common trait for [[tall]] characters). But sometimes the head itself can actually be small (example: post #6139515).

Good examples are certain [[One Piece]] characters.

The best way to find small head posts are to see how many heads tall they are. The average human is generally 7-and-a-half heads tall (including the head). 

h4. Examples

(All including head)
* !post #7827094: Approximately 9 heads tall.
* !post #7489996: Approximately 9.5 heads tall.
* !post #4141598: Almost 6 heads from head to thighs.
* !post #4293671: Comedically small. ([[Anatomical nonsense]])

h4. See also

* [[Big head]]
* [[Chibi]]
* [[Gigantic breasts]]
* [[Huge breasts]]
* [[Large breasts]]
* [[Long legs]]
* [[Tall female]]
* [[Tall male]]

title: occult_studies_club_(blue_archive)
body:
In [[Blue Archive]], the Occult Studies Club is one of the School Clubs at Wild Hunt Academy of Arts.

A club focused on researching the occult and the like, incorporating it into art. Located in the fourth dormitory, room 404, the club is formed by [[Eri (blue archive)|]] by the collective hobbies of all the members. In the pursuit of the occult however, they are often getting themselves into trouble.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

title: genderswap
body:
A "genderswap" refers to the almost magical version of a sex change, wherein a character of one sex turns into one of the other sex without any medical involvement. 

This tag can also apply to an image of a character of one sex depicted as one of the opposite sex (e.g. a male version of a female character or vice versa). May also apply to male-to-[[futanari]] but not to female-to-futanari. A being with no sex depicted as any of these may technically count.

This tag can also be applied to a [[trap]] if the character is given female traits such as the presence of actual [[cleavage]] or the obvious absence of a [[bulge]] at the crotch. For [[reverse trap]]s, the absence of cleavage or presence of a bulge applies.

If a character is genderswapped often enough, the genderswapped version may be given its own name. For male-to-female genderswaps, this is often the normal character's name with "ko" appended to it. (子 "Ko" meaning "child" is a common ending for Japanese girls' names.) For female-to-male genderswaps, "o" is sometimes added. 

Known in Internet circles as Rule 63, wherein there is a female or male version of any given male or female character, respectively.

[b]Notes:[/b] 
* If the person has only swapped bodies with another from the opposite sex, but the body itself has not changed, then use [[personality switch]] instead.
* The "女体化" tag may also on occasion be used to describe female [[personification]], rather than a genderswap.
* If a character in canon is genderswapped but rarely shown in their original form (such as [[Mai Natsume]], [[Tanya Degurechaff]] or [[Oyama Mahiro]]), the tag only applies if said original form is included or somehow alluded to.
* For posts depicting a character undergoing the process of gender transition, use the tag [[gender transitioning]].

h4. Types
h6. to Female
* [[Genderswap (MTF)]]
* [[Genderswap (OTF)]]

h6. to Male
* [[Genderswap (FTM)]]
* [[Genderswap (OTM)]]

h6. to Other
* [[Genderswap (FTO)]]
* [[Genderswap (MTO)]]

h4. See also
* [[Midnight Bliss]]
* [[List of Genderswap Characters]]
* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

title: puttee
body:
A type of [[leg wrap]] that provides protection and compression to the lower leg for long periods of standing and walking. During the early 20th century it was adopted by Western [[military|militaries]] from the British Indian Army and so became popular during [[World War I]] and [[World War II]].

title: phoenix
body:
A mythical sacred fire[[bird]] originated from the [[Greek mythology]]; a fire spirit with a colorful plumage and a tail of gold and scarlet. According to legend the creature always rises from the ashes of its own previously deceased form. It symbolizes immortality and the eternal cycle of death and rebirth. 

h4. See also

* [[bird]]
* [[fenghuang]]
* [[Fujiwara no Mokou]], a character often associated with phoenixes
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]
* [[Hi no Tori]], a franchise created by [[Tezuka Osamu]] based on the mythical creature.
* [[Suzaku]], vermilion bird of the south, one of the "Four Symbols":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four_Symbols_%28China%29 of the Chinese constellations.

title: nosk_(hollow_knight)
body:
A boss in [[Hollow Knight]]. It is a [[spider]]-like creature that lures in prey by disguising itself as other bugs. When encountered, it initially appears as a [[dual persona]] of [[Knight (Hollow Knight)|the player character]], before revealing its true form.

[spoiler]In the Pantheon of Hallownest, a variant known as [[wings|Winged]] Nosk appears, instead disguising itself as [[Hornet (Hollow Knight)|]].[/spoiler]

title: wasp
body:
Social or solitary [[bug|insects]] that have membranous wings, compound eyes, and a [[stinger]]. Unlike [[bee|bees]], they have hairless bodies and large mandibles.

h4. See also

*  [[List of animals]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Wasp":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp

title: bee
body:
A flying insect that pollinates flowers and produces [[honey]] and beeswax. They live as colonies and build [[beehive]]s to store their honey, and possess stingers that inject minuscule amounts of venom in anyone they deem intruders.

The most common type of bee is the European honey bee. Human management of honey bee colonies for honey production is called apiculture or beekeeping.

h4. See also

* [[bee girl]]
* [[beehive]]
* [[honey]]
* [[honeycomb (object)]]
* [[wasp]]

title: ant
body:
Social [[bug]]s known to form colonies, with each ant assigned to a role. While their size may vary, they have mandibles and [[antennae]]. Females might have [[wings]].

They are commonly colored black, brown, or red.

h4. See also

* [[Bee]]
* [[Wasp]]

title: rumia
body:
The "Youkai of the Dusk". Stage 1 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]].

A carnivorous youkai with the ability to [[umbrakinesis|manipulate darkness]] when attacking humans. She dislikes sunlight, concealing herself in darkness to protect herself, but ends up impairing her own vision, leading her to be portrayed as a member of [[Team 9 (touhou)|]], a posse of childish low-tier Touhou characters.

She is best known for her catchphrase "[[Is that so]]~?" (そーなのかー?, "So-nanoka~?"). The Pixiv tag "毎月七日はルーミアの日":[https://www.pixiv.net/en/tags/%E6%AF%8E%E6%9C%88%E4%B8%83%E6%97%A5%E3%81%AF%E3%83%AB%E3%83%BC%E3%83%9F%E3%82%A2%E3%81%AE%E6%97%A5/artworks] ("Maitsuki nanoka ha Rumia no hi" / "The seventh of every month is Rumia day") is a pun off of her catchphrase, since "nanoka" can also mean "七日" ("seventh day"). She is often drawn with her [[spread arms|arms spread]] in a "crucifixion" pose.

On occasion, she is depicted completely surrounded by [[darkness]], flying around as a solid black sphere with only the presence of her catchphrase or her ribbon sticking out from the darkness identifying her.

h4. Appearance

* !post #9193961

h4. See also

* [[is that so]]
* [[Team 9 (touhou)|]]
* [[Ex-Rumia]]
* [[Rumia (darkness)]]
* [[Druma (eveiira)]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Rumia":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Rumia
other_names: 毎月七日はルーミアの日

title: haniyasushin_keiki
body: The Sculptor God Crafted by Utter Isolation The stage six boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is a god that can bring her sculpted idols to life with faith. She is the creator of [[joutouguu_mayumi|Joutouguu Mayumi]] and her [[haniwa_(statue)|haniwa]] army. She has [[pink_eyes|pink eyes]] and wears a [[green headscarf]] atop her [[long_hair|long]], [[blue_hair|blue hair]]. She is adorned with a [[magatama_necklace|magatama necklace]]. Her [[green_apron|green apron]] hangs over her [[yellow_dress|yellow dress]] with a [[single_strap|single strap]] and is filled to the brim with an assortment of [[tools|crafting tools]], such as [[knife|knives]], [[paintbrush|brushes]], and [[pliers]]. She wears a pair of [[sandals]]. Summoned by the enslaved human spirits of the Primate Spirit Garden, she and her idols took control over the Primate Spirit Garden and posed a threat to the Animal Realm at large. Since her idols had no flesh, soul or desire, the beast spirits could not resist them. Hence, the beasts executed their plan of pretending to invade Hell in order to recruit the protagonists, kickstarting the plot of Wily Beast and Weakest Creature in the process. h4. Appearance * !post #6498034 h4. See also * pool #18399 - That's not how you use a Haniwa! h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Keiki Haniyasushin":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Keiki_Haniyasushin

title: joutouguu_mayumi
body: Haniwa Lance Corporal The fifth stage boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is an [[armor|armored]] [[haniwa_(statue)|haniwa]] who leads the Haniwa army of [[Haniyasushin Keiki|Keiki]]. She is skilled in combat arts and can convert loyalty into strength. She wears her [[blonde hair]] in [[double bun|double buns]] with a [[white ribbon| white]] [[hair ribbon]], and is often depicted holding a [[haniwa_(statue)|haniwa]] as a weapon. She wears a plate of [[japanese_armor|armor]] and a pair of [[bloomers]]. h4. Appearance * !post #6498035 h4. See also * pool #18399 - That's not how you use a Haniwa! h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Mayumi Joutouguu":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Mayumi_Joutouguu

title: scruffing
body:
A handling technique in which the loose skin on a cat's neck is grabbed. This is most commonly done by a mother [[cat]] as a means of carrying and transporting her [[kitten]]s, but it is sometimes seen in other animals.

When done to human characters, this may refer to a character grabbing another character by the back or collar of their shirt and lifting them. In which case, consider using [[clothes grab]] and [[lifting person]] as well.

h4. Examples
* !post #8531597
* !post #8736293

title: ushizaki_urumi
body: Parental Guardian of Ancient Fish The second stage boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is an 牛鬼 (ushi-oni or gyuuki), a cow-demon youkai, and has [[cow horns]] atop her [[black_hair|black]] and [[grey_hair|grey]] [[two-tone hair]]. She wears a [[cow print|cow-printed]] [[haori]] over her [[crop top]] and [[yellow shorts]]. She also wears a pair of [[sandals]]. Regularly depicted with much [[alternate breast size (larger)|increased]] breast size in fan works. Her ability is to manipulate the weight of everyday objects, which she once used to increase the weight of the baby statue she holds to drown people. She now lives peacefully by the Sanzu River, where she runs a fishing business, and tries to help people who accidentally come to the river. h4. Appearance * !post #3498583 * !post #6475202 h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Urumi Ushizaki":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Urumi_Ushizaki

title: soap_shoes
body:
SOAP is a brand of [[shoes]] that was founded in 1997. They are designed for [[skateboard]] grinding on railings because of the plastic concavity on their soles.

The shoes are best known for their appearance in the [[Sonic (series)|]] series. In [[Sonic Adventure 2]], [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]] wears a custom version of the Scorcher variant, as grinding was introduced as a gameplay mechanic.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Soap (shoes)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soap_(shoes)
* "Sonic Fandom Wiki":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Grind_Shoes

title: niwatari_kutaka
body: Clerical God of Hell's Checkpoint The third stage boss and extra stage midboss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. Originally a Niwatarijin, god of feral/wild chickens, she currently sorts out humans and oni souls in Hell. She has the ability to heal throat illnesses. Kutaka has a small [[chick]] [[bird_on_head|perched atop]] of her [[blonde_hair|light yellow]]-[[red_hair|red]] [[two-tone hair]]. She has two large [[bird wings]] and a long [[bird tail]]. She wears a [[white shirt]] atop her [[orange dress]]. In [[sunken fossil world|Gouyoku Ibun]], she has a [[whistle]]. h4. Appearance * !post #5305479 h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Kutaka Niwatari":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kutaka_Niwatari

title: noah_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant from [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]], debuted in the Babylon Singularity and designated as the Grand Rider. The depiction of the [[Noah (mythology)|Biblical figure of the same name]].

Right after being summoned, Noah was gravely injured by [[Queen Draco (fate)|]]. He barely managed to survive by entrusting his Saint Graph to [[Captain Nemo (fate)|]]. Before revealing his true identity, Noah pretends to be [[Nemo (Fate/Grand Order Arcade)|]], calling himself "Captain" and strongly resembling an older version of him.

title: nemo_(fate/grand_order_arcade)
body:
Rider-class servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]] appearing as an [[aged up|older]] [[Captain Nemo (Fate)|]]. He wears his hair down or in a [[ponytail]] instead of in [[twintails]] and has [[very long sidelocks]].

Implemented into the mobile version of [[Fate/Grand Order]] with the [[Vanished Beginning]] event. While he is simply known as [b]Nemo[/b] in his first two ascensions and only switches to the title [b]Nemo/Noah[/b] during his third ascension in Arcade, he is known as Nemo/Noah during all his ascensions in the mobile version.

Considered a separate character from the [[Nemo (fate)|Nemo series]]. Only tag both if both are present.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Itefu]]

title: waterhazard_(ben_10)
body:
Waterhazard is the [[Omnitrix]]'s [[DNA]] sample of an Orishan from the planet Kiusana in the Andromeda Galaxy.

Waterhazard appears as a red mollusk-like [[alien]] with [[green eyes]] and a grey mouth that does not move when he speaks. Behind his legs and on the top of his arms are small [[spikes]] that are grey, there are black spots on his shoulders and legs, and on his hands are portholes, which he uses to shoot water. Waterhazard also has four fingers with claws on them and a grey spike on each of his feet. His lower torso is grey with two spikes on the side of it.

title: celestial_dragons_(one_piece)
body:
The [b]Celestial Dragons[/b], also known as the [b]World Nobles[/b], are the aristocratic descendants of nineteen of the First Twenty kingdoms who established what is now known as the World Government. Due to their elite status within the World Government, they are serving as the major antagonists of [[One Piece]].

Most of the Celestial Dragons are often seen with an astronaut-like outfit with its own air supply, ostensibly to prevent the "impure" air that the commoners breathe to "contaminate" them.

h4. See also
* [[Gorosei]]

body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]], #0778 in the National Pokédex, a Ghost/Fairy-type.

Disguises itself as a [[Pikachu]] in an effort to look less scary. Its true appearance is largely unknown, with the only visible parts being its [[solid oval eyes]] and two black, [[claws|clawed]] hands that it sometimes extends from under its rag. title: diona_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character. Voiced by [[Izawa Shiori]] in Japanese.

Diona is the daughter of [[Draff (Genshin Impact)|]], a hunter in Springvale.

title: matsumoto_yoshio
body:
Japanese business magnate and racehorse owner. He was the CEO of "Kishiro Co., Ltd.":[http://www.kishiro-g.co.jp/], a company that manufactures crank shafts for ships. However, he was perhaps more known as a prolific racehorse owner, owning many graded race winners such as [[Meisho Doto (Racehorse)|]], [[Meisho Samson (Racehorse)|]], [[Meisho Mambo (Racehorse)|]], and [[Meisho Tabaru (Racehorse)|]] among others.

title: octopus_hold
body:
Also known as the [b]Octopus Stretch[/b] and in Japanese, the [I]Manji-Gatame[/I], it is a [[submission hold]] where the wrestler stands behind the opponent and hooks a leg over the opponent's opposite leg. The wrestler then forces the opponent to one side, traps one of the opponent's arms with their own arm and drapes their free leg over the neck of the opponent, forcing it downward. This elevates the wrestler and places all the weight of the wrestler on the opponent. The wrestler has one arm free, which can be used for balance. 

It was invented by the late Japanese wrestling legend [[Antonio Inoki]]. Some known users of this hold are [[WWE]] wrestler [[AJ Lee]] (who called her version as the [I]Black Widow[/I]), [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] and [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler Shibata Katsuyori, and [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling]] wrestler Jonathan Gresham. New Japan Pro Wrestling wrestler [[Zack Sabre Jr.]] uses multiple variations of the hold and the late [[World Wonder Ring Stardom]] wrestler [[Kimura Hana]] used a grounded variation that she called as the [I]Hydrangea[/I].

title: ranger_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy aircraft carrier USS [i]Ranger[/i] (CV-4). Character design by [[Hoshiakari (C2 Kikan)]]. Voiced by Natsuko Abe.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[braid]] and [[hair bun]] on the side, [[blue eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[two-tone dress]] colored white and Navy Blue, a [[blue skirt]], [[blue necktie]], [[white panties]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[boots]]. 

Her rigging consists of her real-life island superstructure on her right, a 12.7 cm single gun mount on her left, and her real-life [[flight deck]] used as a portable case.

She is portrayed as a [[drunk]]ard for reasons that have yet to be determined.

In real life, [i]Ranger[/i] was the US Navy's first aircraft carrier designed and built from scratch. In [[World War II]], she primarily saw combat in the Atlantic and Mediterranean theaters as her comparatively slow speed, minimal armor, and limited plane capacity prevented her from seeing service in the Pacific other than training duties from 1944 onward.

title: kamen_rider_gavv_(poppingummy_form)
body:
This is the base form of [[Kamen Rider Gavv]].
It is based on grape-flavored [[gummy candy|gummy candies]], and its purple-toned armor is resilient and able to repel attacks. It's armor also reduces damage to the Gavv by shattering itself when it takes damage above its limits.
The special move [b]Poppingummy Finish[/b] is a [[rider kick]].

h4. Derived forms.
h5. Kickingummy Assist
This is the form he transforms into using Kickingummy [[Gochizo]], which is based on orange -flavored gummy candy.
It is clad in large orange boot on his right leg, which enhances its kicking power.
It's special move is the [b]Kickingummy Kick[/b], which crushes the enemy with its right foot while falling from the air.


h5. Punchingummy Assist
This is the form he transforms into using Punchingummy Gochizo, which is based on soda -flavored gummy candy.
It is clad in large light blue punching glove on his right arm, which enhances its punching power.
It's special move is the [b]Punchingummy Punch[/b], in which multiple punching gloves are remotely controlled to attack the enemy in succession and then punch him.

h5. Kickingummy and Punchingummy Assist
This is the form he transforms into using Kickingummy and Punchingummy Gochizo.
It is equipped with Kickingummy Assist boot and Punchingummy Assist punching glove.

title: haiseiko_(umamusume)
body:
NPC Character from [[Umamusume]], voiced by [[Tange Sakura]]. She is effectively Japan's first "umadol", having successfully made the crossover from the Regionals to Central and caused the "Haiseiko Boom" (this is the same career path [[Oguri Cap (umamusume)|]] would take afterwards, taking the fan boom to new heights).

Her appearance is ostensibly based on [[Matsuda Seiko]], given her [[name connection|namesake]] and time of popularity. In game, she is the very reason why [[Smart Falcon (umamusume)|]] taken the path to become an umadol.


h4. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Haiseiko":[https://umamusume.jp/character/haiseiko]

title: lodestar_(ben_10)
body:
Lodestar is the [[Omnitrix]]'s DNA sample of a Biotsavartian from the planet Maxwell.

Lodestar has a magnetically [[disembodied head|floating metal head]] surrounded by a glowing white [[aura]] and levitates in an arch between his shoulders. He has crab-like [[claws]] for hands (similar to [[Brainstorm (Ben 10)]]'s) and his body is mainly brownish-black with yellow feet, hands, shoulders, and chest. His body is also made of living alien metal.

In [[Ben 10: Omniverse|Omniverse]], Lodestar has a yellow eyebrow-like crest on his forehead, which looks similar to that of Jetray. His head is more skull-shaped with has lines beneath his mouth. The glowing aura around his head is recolored green, the yellow from his feet go up to his thighs, his shoulders are now larger, and the yellow stripes by his chest are shorter.

Lodestar wears the original [[Omnitrix|Omnitrix/Ultimatrix/Omnitrix]] symbol on his chest.

title: katsuragi_izumi
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Edel Note]] from the 104th graduating class, first introduced as a first-year at [[mizukawa school uniform|Mizukawa Girls' High School]]. She joined Hasu no Sora at the start of the 105th year.

A girl with great potential that excels at everything. She became a school idol after getting scouted by [[ceras yanagida lilienfeld|Ceras]]. She loves seeing people working hard towards their dreams and can’t help but get involved.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in a [[wolf cut]] and [[orange eyes]] with [[slit pupils]]. Her hair is adorned with two [[triangle hair ornament]]s.

Her first appearance has her wear a [[double-breasted]] [[black coat|black]] [[collared coat|collared]] [[coat]] with [[long sleeves]], and [[black gloves]].

Voiced by [[Shindou Amane]].

title: rakkun_sutaru_(old_design)
body:
The original design of [[Rakkun Sutaru]]. Comprises the various early versions and depictions of her character from 2014 through late 2020, before coming up with her [[rakkun sutaru (1st costume)|definitive design]], and debuting as a VTuber on August 2021.

These versions often present Rakkun with a more [[tomboy]] or masculine appearance and/or clothing, and presents little to no animal traits. She has [[purple eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], featuring [[red hair|red]] [[colored tips|tips]] or [[streaked hair|streaks]]. Often depicted wearing [[shirt|shirts]] or red/brown pieces of clothing. One recognizable outfit consists of a [[white shirt]] with a [[necktie]], a [[sweater vest]], and [[blue pants|blue]] [[capri pants]] with checkered details.

title: hoshiguma_yuugi
body:
The "Rumored Unnatural Phenomenon". Stage 3 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Subterranean Animism]][/i]. Has the ability to control supernatural phenomena, but is usually just depicted as physically strong.

Yuugi is an [[oni]] with a [[single horn|single]] [[red horns|red horn]] with a [[star (symbol)|]] jutting out of her forehead. Like her old friend [[Ibuki Suika]] (both of whom were part of the "Four Devas of the Mountains"), Yuugi likes drinking out of her [[sakazuki]] and causing a ruckus. She now lives underground in the Ancient City and guides anyone entering the Palace of Earth Spirits, but only if she is defeated. Often paired with [[Mizuhashi Parsee]].

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] that [[parted bangs|parts]] at her [[cone horns|horn]]. Her outfit is a plain [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] and a [[vertical-striped skirt|striped]] [[blue skirt|blue]] and [[red skirt]], and [[geta]]. Like the other oni, she wears [[shackles]] with a broken [[chain]].

title: plants_vs._zombies
body:
Plants vs. Zombies is a tower defense and strategy video game developed and originally published by PopCap Games for Windows and OS X in May 2009.

In Plants vs. Zombies, players take the role of a homeowner in the midst of a zombie apocalypse. To defend their home from zombies, some which have unique abilities, the player uses plants that can fire projectiles at, give "sun" to purchase other plants to help or block the advancing zombies. Players must plan defenses in multiple "lanes" across the home's lawn and should a zombie make it to the house on any lane, the game is over. Director George Fan was inspired to make the game after playing other tower defense titles and desiring to eliminate the typical strategies of sending advancing enemies through mazes of defenses, instead adapting the lane approach to remove this strategy.

The game would inspire a franchise, one which would even have a ton of exclusive content made for it in China.

title: kachimachi_kosuzu
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[DOLLCHESTRA]] from the 104th graduating class. 

She wants to find "something she can be proud of," as she feels she has no talent. This drives her to try many things to challenge herself. 

She has [[pink eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[brown hair]] styled in [[side braids]] tied behind her head with a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow|bow]] and [[center-flap bangs]]. Often has a [[side ahoge]] off to her left.

Voiced by [[Hayama Fuka]].

title: yugiri_tsuzuri
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[DOLLCHESTRA]] from the 102nd graduating class. 

She is often absent-minded, and has a peculiar way of speaking. But on stage, she is an excellent performer.

She has [[red eyes|red]]/[[pink eyes]] and [[short hair]] which is predominantly [[white hair|white]]-to-[[grey hair|grey]] with [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[colored inner hair|inner hair]]. Her hair is typically styled in an [[inverted bob]] with [[diagonal bangs]] and [[star hair ornament]]s. In her first year at Hasu no Sora, she used to wear a black [[hairclip]].

She often wears [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]], a [[black choker|black]] [[o-ring choker]], [[black pantyhose|black]] [[pantyhose]], and [[black shoes]] with her [[winter uniform|winter]] [[hasu no sora school uniform|uniform]]. She also wears the choker with her [[summer uniform]]. 

She has graduated from Hasu no Sora along with fellow 102nd year members [[Otomune Kozue]] and [[Fujishima Megumi]] in March 2025, thus ending her school idol activities at Hasu no Sora. 
Her next goal after graduation is to be a [[teacher]].

Voiced by [[Sasaki Kotoko]].

title: momose_ginko
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Cerise Bouquet]] from the 104th graduating class. 

She is a girl who loves tradition. [[momose ginko's grandmother|Her grandmother]] was a member of the Performing Arts Club, which later became the School Idol Club. As a Kanazawa native, she sometimes slips into the [[kanazawaben|Kanazawa dialect]] out of surprise. She defaults to it when speaking with her family.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[green hair|green]]-ish [[black hair]] styled in a [[blunt ends|blunt]] [[bob cut]] and [[blunt bangs]] with a [[hair flower]] and [[flower knot]] on her left.

She wears [[black pantyhose]] with her [[hasu no sora school uniform|school uniform]].

Voiced by [[Sakurai Hina]].

title: murano_sayaka
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[DOLLCHESTRA]] from the 103rd graduating class. 

She is clumsy, but is also a genuine hard worker. She also does [[figure skating]]; getting better at it was her initial motivation for becoming a school idol. In her third year, she acts as co-president of the School Idol Club along with [[Hinoshita Kaho]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]]. Her hair in her first two years is usually tied with [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon|ribbons]] in [[low twintails]]. In her third and final year, she has it in a [[half updo]] tied with two ribbons, one blue and one [[red ribbon|red]], and a [[star hair ornament]], all located at the back of her head. She also has a [[mole on neck|mole on her neck]].

She typically wears her [[winter uniform|winter]] [[hasu no sora school uniform|uniform]] with an [[open cardigan|open]] [[brown cardigan|brown]] [[cardigan]].

Voiced by [[Nonaka Kokona]].

title: skill_issue_(meme)
body:
A backhanded, "fake polite" response addressed to someone to [[you're doing it wrong|suggest they are not competent]] (or not [i]yet[/i] competent) at whatever they are currently doing, especially [[playing games]]. Essentially synonymous with calling someone a "noob".

Thought to originate from the community of the [[Roblox]] game [i]Rogue Lineage[/i] before migrating to and becoming popular via the community for [[The Binding of Isaac]].

h4. See Also
* [[Get Good (meme)]]

title: otomune_kozue
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Cerise Bouquet]] from the 102nd graduating class. 

Former club president of the School Idol Club. She was an honor student well respected around Hasu no Sora, but she is humble. She is bad at technology, but claims she is getting better.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]]. Her hair is typically done up in a [[side ponytail]], [[sidelocks]], and a [[single side bun]] on her right with a [[red flower|red]] [[hair flower]] and [[tassel hair ornament]] on. Sometimes, a [[lone nape hair]] is visible. In her first year at Hasu no Sora, she used to tie her hair in a [[low ponytail]] and had a more serious attitude in contrast with her fellow first-years at the time.

She has graduated from Hasu no Sora along with fellow 102nd year members [[Yugiri Tsuzuri]] and [[Fujishima Megumi]] in March 2025, thus ending her school idol activities at Hasu no Sora. 
Her next goal after graduation is to become a professional composer.

Voiced by [[Hanamiya Nina]].

title: fujishima_megumi
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Mira-Cra Park!]] from the 102nd graduating class. 

She has been working in the entertainment industry from a young age, so she is aware of her cuteness and is willing to work hard to be seen as such. She is childhood friends with [[Osawa Rurino]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her hair is typically put up in a [[two side up]] hairstyle. 

She has graduated from Hasu no Sora along with fellow 102nd year members [[Otomune Kozue]] and [[Yugiri Tsuzuri]] in March 2025, thus ending her school idol activities at Hasu no Sora.
Her next goal after graduation is to become a better performer, starting by moving to California.

Voiced by [[Tsukine Kona]].

title: osawa_rurino
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Mira-Cra Park!]] from the 103rd graduating class. 

She may seem like an energetic party girl at first, but when she runs out of energy, she goes into what she calls a "dead battery" state. She is childhood friends with [[Fujishima Megumi]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[blonde hair|blonde]]-to-[[blue hair]]. Her hair is typically put up in [[twintails]] and prominently [[parted bangs]], with a pair of [[white flower|white]] and [[pink flower|pink]] [[hair flower|hair flowers]]. She is often depicted with a single [[fang]]. 

From her third year, she may be seen with what looks like a [[wedding ring]] on her right hand's ring finger. This ring is a parting gift from Megumi.

Voiced by [[Kan Kanna]].

title: shantae_advance:_risky_revolution
body:
Shantae Advance: Risky Revolution! is a platform video game developed and published by [[WayForward]]. It is the sixth game in the [[Shantae (Series)|]] series, chronologically taking place between the original [[Shantae (2002 Game)|]] (2002) and [[Shantae: Risky's Revenge]] (2010). The game follows the half-genie [[Shantae]] as she explores the world of Sequin Land and attempts to prevent her nemesis [[Risky Boots]] from using a subterranean device to terraform the world.

The game was originally in development for the [[Game Boy Advance]] but was cancelled in 2004 after failing to get a publisher at the time. In 2023, it was announced that development for the game had resumed with the Game Boy Advance version of the game being released in April 2025 by Limited Run Games, and the digital release for modern platforms being released in August 2025.

h4. External Links
* "Official Website":https://wayforward.com/games/shantae-advance-risky-revolution
other_names: シャンティアドバンス:リスキーレボリューション

title: queen_of_sheba_(fate)
body:
A Caster-class servant met in the "[[Salem (fate/grand order)|Salem of the Heresy]]" chapter of [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i]'s Epic of Remnant substory as the [b]Caster of Midrash[/b]. She in truth is the Queen of Sheba, one of [[Solomon (fate)|]]'s wives, operating under the name [i]Tituba[/i] while in Salem. Her True Name is unknown.

She is depicted as being extremely greedy, and will usually do anything for any valuable items (especially [[gold]] and [[money]]).

title: kunreishiki
body:
"Kunrei-shiki romanization":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunrei-shiki_romanization is the system for romanizing Japanese characters officially promoted by the Japanese government and taught in schools. It's intended to maintain consistency with the way kana are written without being a literal representation of the way the syllables actually sound (e.g., "ti", "tu", "sa", "si" and "sya" instead of "chi", "tsu, "sa", "shi" and "sha".) For this reason, many English speakers find that it looks strange and prefer to use "Hepburn romanization":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hepburn_romanization, which is also used in the spelling of tags throughout Danbooru.

Many names (e.g. [[Ito Noizi]] and [[Matikanefukukitaru (Umamusume)|]]) use Kunrei-shiki, whether by artistic choice ("Itou Noiji") or existing limitations that would make it difficult to use Hepburn ("Machikane Fukukitaru").

See also: [[Romaji text]].

title: diyusi_(cookie)
body:
Hinase Haruka as [[Daiyousei]] in the original [[Cookie (Touhou)|Cookie☆]]. Typically seen with [[traffic baton]], [[high-visibility vest]], and [[road sign]]s. She has a [[high ponytail|ponytail]] instead of a sidetail, pale or [[white skin]], and almost always has her eyes closed.

Originally an unimportant character, getting overshadowed by [[Cirno (cookie)|]] and [[Nadeko (cookie)|]]. This began to change in 2014 when a BB theater of her directing traffic became a little popular. Then in 2017, [[OFFSide: DIYUSI]] began and she became one of the most popular characters in the entire fandom. Her character is almost entirely defined from MADs and fan videos, separate from the original voice drama and anything about Hinase. This would later cause Cirno to drift too, becoming the Security Guard to match DIYUSI's Crossing Guard. She even received her own derivative character in [[SIYUDI (cookie)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21031333: Profile

title: primrose_field_illusion
body:
The Primrose Field Illusion is an [[optical illusion]] created by Professor [[Kitaoka Akiyoshi]], a Japanese psychologist and expert in visual perception. The illusion features a simple pattern of light green and dark green squares, with primroses (magenta and white) in the corners of the squares.

When viewed, the pattern appears to undulate or wave, creating a sense of motion. This illusion is an example of a peripheral drift illusion, where the brain interprets static visual information as dynamic motion. The Primrose Field Illusion is particularly striking due to its use of color, which enhances the perceived motion.

The illusion works by exploiting the way the brain processes visual information. Our brains are wired to recognize patterns and motion, and the Primrose Field Illusion takes advantage of this by presenting a subtle, gradient-like pattern that our brains interpret as movement. The use of color and the specific arrangement of the squares create a sense of depth and dimensionality, further reinforcing the illusion.

title: e.y.e:_divine_cybermancy
body: E.Y.E: Divine Cybermancy (stylized E.Ψ.Ǝ: Divine Cybermancy) is a first person shooter/roleplaying game created by French studio Streum On Studio. Set in the same dark science fiction universe as their [[Half-Life 1|Half Life]] mod Syndicate Black Ops, E.Y.E is noteworthy for its massive, sprawling levels which pushes the Source Engine to its limits and fully entrapping the player within the cycles of guilt by himself or with up to 31 co-sufferers.

title: naoko_musashi
body:
Love interest and wife of [[Joe Musashi]], main protagonist of the [[shinobi_(game)|SHINOBI]] series of action [[video game]]s by [[SEGA]].  

She has a gentle and kind personality, but is also strong-willed, and is a great support to Musashi in many ways, such as giving him advice at times.

title: hinoshita_kaho
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Cerise Bouquet]] from the 103rd graduating class. 

An extremely energetic girl, she enrolled into the academy in order to "bloom". In her third year, she acts as co-president of the School Idol Club along with [[Murano Sayaka]].

She has [[aqua eyes]] (sometimes depicted [[green eyes|green]]) and [[medium hair|medium]] [[orange hair]]. Her hair is usually styled with [[crossed bangs]], side ahoge-like [[two side up]], and [[rabbit hair ornament|rabbit hair ornaments]] on either side of her face.

Voiced by [[Nirei Nozomi]].

title: jinu_(kpop_demon_hunters)
body:
A character from the Netflix movie [[Kpop_demon_hunters|K-Pop Demon Hunters]]. He is the leader of the Saja Boys.

In human form, he has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. 
In demon form, his skin turns [[purple skin|purple]], [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]], and dark demonic marks appear on his body, similar to tattoos. The [[body markings]] can also appear in human form, having a lighter color.

He has two supernatural animals as pets, a blue tiger named [[Derpy (kpop Demon Hunters)|]] and a six-eyed magpie named [[Sussie (Kpop Demon Hunters)|]].

title: ana_(overwatch)
body:
A hero in [[Overwatch]], added to Overwatch 1 on July 16, 2016. [[Pharah (overwatch)|]]'s mother. A Support hero, she uses her sniper rifle to heal targets from far away, as well as being able to put enemies to sleep. Her conversations with other characters show that they nearly all consider her the Team Mom, and all of her quotes are likewise very motherly.

title: sombra_(overwatch)
body:
Playable character in [[Overwatch]], first introduced in Overwatch 1 on November 15, 2016.

One of the world's most notorious hackers, Sombra uses information to manipulate those in power. Formerly a gang member in Mexico, Sombra stumbled upon a global web of conspiracy and was burned. She went into hiding, became a [[cyborg]], and joined the terrorist organization Talon, working alongside [[Reaper (Overwatch)|]], [[Widowmaker (Overwatch)|]], and [[Doomfist (Overwatch)|]].

title: junker_queen_(overwatch)
body:
An [[Overwatch]] character.

Real name: Odessa "Dez" Stone
Age: 35-40 (approx.)
Occupation: Gladiator champion (formerly), Ruler of Junkertown
Base: Junkertown, Australia

A former wastelander, Odessa "Dez" Stone has ruled the squabbling Junker factions for over a decade. Everywhere she goes is her battlefield of choice, every seat is her throne, and everyone on the planet is her subject, whether they know it or not. Her tale of conquest is just beginning...

The Junker Queen is the uncontested ruler of the chaotic city of Junkertown. Armed with a shotgun, her knife Gracie, and her axe Carnage, she delights in wreaking havoc on the front line of battle.

VA: Leah De Niese (Overwatch 2), Siho Ellsmore/Davida McKenzie (Overwatch 1), Bianca Krahl (German)

title: mauga_(overwatch)
body:
A character in [[Overwatch|Overwatch 2]].

A Samoan tank-class hero working for Talon. He comes off as a big brute character dual wielding a pair of miniguns. However, he's much smarter than he gives off.  

Real Name: Maugaloa Malosi
Birthday: August 19
Age: 37
Voiced by: [[John Tui]] 

h4. External links

title: hazard_(overwatch)
body:
A character in [[Overwatch|Overwatch 2]].

A Scottish tank-class hero. Hazard had a rough childhood as he grew up in poverty, his mother passing away at a young age, a neglectful father, and being bullied at school. During his time the military, an Overwatch jet was shot out of the air by a Talon ship. It crashed into his apartment, killing his father, and burying him under rubble. He survived, but he ended up a [[triple amputee]], ultimately ending his military career. Scorned by the incident and receiving bare minimum support from the government, he turned to an underground rebel group called the Phreaks.

Real Name: Findlay Docherty
Birthday: November 11
Age: 24
Voiced by: [[Conor McLeod]] 

h4. External Links

* "Overwatch Wiki: Hazard":[https://overwatch.fandom.com/wiki/Hazard]

body:

Formerly named "Jesse McCree" after one of the former developers who was involved in a sexual harassment lawsuit at Blizzard Entertainment. title: overwatch_2
body:
Follow-up to Blizzard's [i][[Overwatch 1|Overwatch]][/i], released on October 4, 2022 as a patch to the original game, fully replacing it.

The title featured a roadmap for an expanded PvE mode & an adjusted game balance (including moving from 6v6 to 5v5).

As of May 16, 2023, the skill trees and "Hero Missions" part of the PvE work was cancelled.

title: yukadon
body:
One character slapping their hands against the ground while the other character is [[lying]] [[on back|on their back]], effectively [[pinned|pinning]] them. Commonly in a [[kneeling]] and [[arm support]] position.

Use [[yukadon on viewer]] for a yukadon in [[pov| first person]].

It is basically the lying down version of [[kabedon]]. Variants include [[on ground]], [[on floor]], [[on bed]], [[on table]]/[[on desk]], etc. Use [[kabedon]] if it's not distinguishable whether the character is standing or lying.

h4. See also

title: digitigrade
body:
A non-human character who walks on their toes rather than the sole of their foot. In real life, many animals are digitigrade, including [[cat]]s, [[dog]]s, and [[fox]]es.

This tag primarily refers to humanoid ([[furry]], [[monster girl]], kemonomimi, [[taur]]) characters that have a digitigrade body structure, as well as some [[monster]]s. This tag also includes a similar [[hooves|hooved]] leg structure known as "unguligrade", where an animal walks on the tips of their hooves.

Sometimes called "reverse-jointed", as digitigrade legs can look like they have a knee that bends forward instead of backward like a human knee. However this "knee" actually corresponds to the human heel; on a quadruped, the knee analogue may not be immediately apparent.

For the equivalent feature on a [[mecha]], see [[reverse-jointed legs]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8451993

h4. See also

* [[Animal feet]]
* [[Satyr]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Digitigrade":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digitigrade]

title: lang_xian_(weapon)
body:
AKA the "wolf brush" or "wolf bamboo" or "multiple tipped bamboo spear". A branched, multi-tipped spear with blades attached to the branches. The blades could be dipped in poison. 

It was probably an invention of the Chinese general [[Qi Jiguang]] of the [[Ming Dynasty]], who described it in his manual titled Jixiao Xinshu. The manual describes that the lang xian acted as backup for the [[rattan shield]] bearers in a "mandarin duck formation". In Korea, the weapon was known as nangseon and where Joseon received training in its use from Ming during the [[Imjin War]].

title: whore_of_babylon
body: Babylon the Great, commonly known as the Whore of Babylon, refers to both a symbolic female figure and a place of malevolence as mentioned in the Book of Revelation of the New Testament. Her full title is stated in Revelation 17:5 as "Mystery, Babylon the Great, the Mother of Harlots and Abominations of the Earth".

title: flamethrower
body:
A [[weapon]] designed to launch [[fire]] over a distance, generally using pressurized-gel that either ignites in contact with the air or is otherwise lit as it exits the nozzle. The gel sticks to anything that it touches as it burns. Has a distinctive whoosh sound.

It has been used throughout [[World War I]] and [[World War II]] and saw limited use as late as the [[Vietnam war]], usually to attack enemies inside fortifications or hiding among the trees.

[[Warhammer 40k]] makes extensive use of flamethrowers. It is also the primary weapon for the [[Pyro (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]].

h4. See also
* [[Napalm]]

title: cinquedea
body: A type of broad, tapering [[short sword]] or large [[dagger]] used during the Italian renaissance in the 15th and 16th Centuries. 'Cinquedea' means 'five fingers,' which refers to the number of fullers (grooves in a blade to reduce weight) they often had, though some specimens have three or four.

title: daiyousei
body:
Daiyousei's name is fangiven, meaning literally "great fairy." [[Touhou]] midboss of [[Cirno]]'s stage in [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]]. 

Thought to be friends with her, portrayed as more mature and coolheaded than other fairies. In Oriental Sacred Place, she was portrayed as incredibly shy, hiding from anyone that wasn't Cirno. The Fandom might draw her with larger breasts than any other fairy, thanks to her fan name.

She has [[green hair]] in a [[high side ponytail]] tied with a [[yellow bow|yellow]] [[hair bow]] and her eyes are usually either [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[green eyes|green]]. She wears a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[yellow ascot]], and either a [[skirt set|paired]] [[blue vest]] and [[blue skirt]] or a [[blue dress|blue]] [[pinafore dress]]. Out of all the Touhou fairies, she is most frequently depicted with [[white wings|white]] [[fairy wings]]. 

In [[Whispered Oracle of Hakurei Shrine]], her ability has been revealed as "to swim through mist". Whether this means she can move through the mist with incredible ease, as if she's teleporting through them, or her "swim through mist" is more akin to "thrive in the mist" and become stronger in the mist is up to interpretation.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24773281: Profile

h4. See also

* [[Daiyousei mob (Touhou)]], two other fairies with the same wing type

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Daiyousei":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Daiyousei

title: improvised_weapon
body: An object not made to be a weapon used as one.

title: strongman_waist
body:
In contrast to the slimmer waist commonly seen with bodybuilders ([[v-taper]]), a [i]strongman waist[/i] is a thick, wide and [[muscular]] waist that is typical of strongmen and represents strength over aesthetics. It is a common design choice with the homoerotic [[bara]] art style.

Use with [[belly]] and [[plump]] if drawn softly, but there has to be at least a hint of musculature to warrant using this tag.

h4. Comparison and examples

* !asset #5812861: "Source":[https://www.deviantart.com/coelasquid/art/Abdomination-How-to-draw-beef-132538271]
* !post #6978138 
* !post #7434813
* !post #7443216

h4. See also

* [[broad shoulders]]
* [[muscular male]]
* [[belly]] 
* [[plump]] 
* [[fat man]]

* "Wikipedia: Strongman":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strongman]

title: surfer_(arknights)
body:
[i][[Blacksteel Worldwide (arknights)|Blacksteel]] advance recon team member Surfer, always looking forward to her next camping trip.[/i]

A playable Vanguard operator from [[Arknights]].

Real name: Tila

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]

      [td]165 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]

Initially introduced as an NPC in the [i]Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures[/i] side story, she has become playable in [i]Such is the Joy of Our Reunion[/i].

Her motif is based on Abert's squirrel.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Maeda Kei (JP), Chen Yang (CN), Dev Joshi (EN), and Kim Seo-hyun (KR). 
Her illustrator is [[reoen]].

title: vritra_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant introduced in the [[Eikou no Santa Claus Road|Christmas 2020 event]] of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A serpent, dragon or demon in Hinduism, known as the personification of drought who kept the world's water captive until he was slain by [[Indra (fate)|]].

She chooses to appear in Fate/Grand Order as a [[dragon girl]], though as a [[dragon]] she didn't inherently have a gender. She wields the [[vajra (object)|]] that defeated her, now in the form of a [[spear]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[La-na]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Asahina Madoka]]

title: percival_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant introduced in the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|British Lostbelt]] of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The second Knight of the Round Table, also known as the Holy Knight of the Dove. He wields the [[spear]] [[Longinus (weapon) (fate)|Longinus]] in battle. He and [[Sinfjotli (fate)|]] are the two servants of [[Gagam Istorre]] in [[Fate:Lost Einherjar]].

In [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]], [spoiler]he is actually the adoptive younger brother of [[Melusine (fate)|]]. He was given [[Aesc (fate)|]]'s [[Staff of Selection (fate)|Spear of Selection]] by his foster mother, [[Aurora (fate)|]], in order to fight against the calamities facing Britain. Using its power causes him to lose years off his lifespan, resulting in his adult appearance while actually only being fourteen.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Shiramine (srmn09)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Matsukaze Masaya]]

title: bartholomew_roberts_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He first appeared as an NPC in the [[Madou Meihou-sou no Kousatsu]] event before being introduced as a playable servant in the 5th anniversary.

A Welsh pirate who raided ships around the Americas and West Africa, and considered to be the most successful pirate of the Golden Age of Piracy as determined by the number of captured ships. He was killed by a grapeshot cannon during a naval battle and had his corpse thrown overboard so he could be buried at sea.

He is also known as [b]Black Bart[/b] or [b]Salazar[/b]. Loves [[hair over one eye|mekakure]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[azuazuazu19]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Kobayashi Chiaki]]

title: mileena_(mortal_kombat)
body:
[b]Mileena[/b] is a character in the [[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] series. One of the most popular female characters of the franchise, primarily due to her strikingly seductive overall appearance in contrast to her large, sharp-toothed mouth which she usually covers up with her mask.

In her portrayals, Mileena is depicted as an antagonistic sisterly figure of [[Kitana]], with her origin varying between each incarnation. In the first two timelines, she is depicted as a botched clone of Kitana specifically ordered by [[Shao Kahn]] to be served as a "substitute" of Kitana in case his adopted daughter found out about the truth of her origins.

Meanwhile, in the [[mortal kombat 1 (2023)|third timeline]], Mileena is depicted as the biological older sister of Kitana, though she has been infected by a virus known as 'Tarkat', which disfigured her lower face and often causes her to go on a rampage in the event she had not periodically taken the serum needed to control it. She's re-characterized as the confident-yet-noble heir apparent of the Outworld throne, and is capable of keeping her fully human appearance with the use of the aforementioned serum.
other_names: ミレーナ(モータルコンバット)

title: bow
body:
A bow is a type of knot generally featuring two loops and two loose ends.  Bows will be seen on clothing (many [[serafuku]] have them), in hair, on [[panties]] and other [[lingerie]], on shoes (shoelaces are usually tied in a bow), and pretty much any place that there is something that might be tied.

Bows are often made of [[ribbon|ribbons]], but the same object shouldn't be tagged as both.  If the bow's tail is far longer than its width, tag it as [[ribbon]] instead.

If a bow is tied at the neck in place of a [[necktie]] it should also be noted as a [[bowtie]].

title: sooty_tern
body:
The sooty tern (Onychoprion fuscatus) is a tern in the family Laridae. It is a seabird of the tropical oceans and can fly for years at a time, skimming the sea surface for food, and returning to land only to breed, on islands throughout the equatorial zone.[3][4]

Taxonomy
The sooty tern was described by Carl Linnaeus in 1766 as Sterna fuscata, bearing this name for many years until the genus Sterna was split up; it is now classified in the genus Onychoprion as Onychoprion fuscatus.[5][6] The genus name is from ancient Greek onux, "claw" or "nail", and prion, "saw". The species name fuscatus is Latin for "dark".[7]

The sooty tern has little interspecific variation, but it is usually divided into six to eight allopatric subspecies. Some recent authors further subdivide the Indopacific population into up to eight subspecies altogether,[citation needed] but much of the variation is clinal. The affinities of eastern Pacific birds (including O. f. manutarus of Easter Island) are most strongly contested.[citation needed] Six subspecies are currently accepted by the IOC:[5] 
* !asset #32043416

title: ribbon
body:
A ribbon is a thin band of flexible material, typically cloth but also plastic or sometimes metal, used primarily for binding and tying.  Often seen used in elaborate clothing and hair, and generally longer than it is wide.

A ribbon may be tied into any sort of knot, often a [[bow]], but should not be tagged as both.

title: russo-ukrainian_war
body:
A [[war]] between [[Russia]] and [[Ukraine]] that began in February 2014. The conflict has included the following events:

* The 2014 annexation of Crimea
* The Donbas War since 2014
* The 2021 Russian military buildup near the Ukrainian borders
* The 2022 full-scale invasion of Ukraine
* Wagner leader [[Yevgeny Prigozhin]]'s mutiny against the Russian military leadership in June 2023, and subsequent death in August
* The August 2024 surprise incursion of Ukrainian Forces into Kursk Oblast, Russia.
* [[North Korea]] sending their troops in October 2024 at Kursk.

title: joe_musashi
body:
Main protagonist of the [[shinobi_(game)|SHINOBI]] series of action [[video game]]s by [[SEGA]]. 

He appears in the [[shinobi_(arcade)|Shinobi]] arcade game from 1987 as well as its sequels [[The Super Shinobi]], [[Shadow Dancer]], [[The Super Shinobi II]] and [[Shin Shinobi Den]].

[b]Joe Musashi[/b] is a veteran expert [[ninja]] master. Despite his vast knowledge of the ninja arts, he is quite pragmatic and unorthodox in his approach to combat.

He fights by throwing (an almost) infinite number of [[shuriken]]s or [[kunai]]s, and employs firearms for long range attacks, while using [[martial arts]] moves and [[katana]]s for melee combat.

Joe also uses different types of powerful ninja [[magic]] as well as a deadly white ninja dog called [[shadow_(shadow_dancer)|Shadow]].

title: ninja_gaiden_dragon_sword
body: Set six months after Ninja Gaiden, Ryu Hayabusa has rebuilt the Hayabusa Village. When fellow villager and kunoichi, Momiji, is kidnapped by the Black Spider Ninja Clan, he is forced to find her, while uncovering the secrets behind the mysterious Dark Dragonstones and their relation to the Dragon Lineage.

title: ninja_gaiden_sigma_2
body: Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2, stylized as Ninja Gaiden Σ2, is a 2009 action-adventure game developed by Team Ninja and published by Tecmo Koei for the PlayStation 3. It is a port of the 2008 Xbox 360 video game Ninja Gaiden II. It includes the entirety of the original story mode as well as various changes to the game's design, along with updated textures and a 720p resolution. The game changes Ninja Gaiden II in a similar, but not identical way to how Ninja Gaiden Sigma changed the original Ninja Gaiden. A port for the PlayStation Vita, titled Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2 Plus (Ninja Gaiden Σ2+), was released in 2013.

title: ninja_gaiden_sigma
body: Ninja Gaiden Sigma is the second remake of Ninja Gaiden, and incorporates several features found in Black.

title: yaiba:_ninja_gaiden_z
body:
Yaiba: Ninja Gaiden Z is a 2014 action-adventure game and a spin-off of the [[ninja gaiden]]

Set in the universe, "Earth-14", the game follows the exploits of the powerful ninja Yaiba Kamikaze. Yaiba was once part of a clan that tested the abilities of its ninja by putting them up against a highly skilled member; in this case it was Yaiba they had to face. However, after growing weary of his work, Yaiba eventually decides to massacre his own clan and leave the survivors to their deaths. At one point he meets with the franchise mainstay Ryu Hayabusa and decides to challenge him, claiming that he is the weakest foe Yaiba has encountered thus far. During the battle he discovers otherwise as Ryu slices Yaiba's left arm and eye, killing him.

Later, Yaiba is discovered by a mysterious organization known as Forge Industries, led by Alrico del Gonzo, brings him back to life and restores his lost body parts with mechanized duplicates, thus turning him into a cyborg, with a female scientist named Miss Monday as his navigator.

title: ninja_gaiden_ragebound
body:
Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound is A spin-off of the [[Ninja Gaiden]] series

The game's story runs parallel to the events of Ninja Gaiden (1988) and stars new protagonists Kenji Mozu, who defends Hayabusa Village from demons while Ryu Hayabusa is in America.

title: zerukalo_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] and [[Moriya Suwako]] in [[Cookie (Touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆☆☆]], [[Konpaku Youmu]] in Onsen☆, [[Yorigami Shion]] in Gorgonzola☆. Her appearance in Kuso☆☆☆☆☆ went basically completely unnoticed, was the breakout star in the completely unremarkable Onsen☆, and achieved peak popularity in Gorgonzola☆. She's gone by several names but settled on зеркало (mirror in Russian). 

Started voice acting around 12 years old in 2013 but her frequent name changes made her blend in with the vast amount of other wannabes and didn't get any parts until 2015. Her appearance in Onsen☆ as the [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] Youmu who digs the onsen with a combination [[shovel]] and [[pickaxe]] first started giving her fan art. This was then followed by her main role as Shion in Gorgonzola☆ where her pitiful appearance and role had people sympathize with her. This was also compounded by the discovery that when she was connected with one of her previous names that admitted she was living in government poverty housing when she first started looking for roles.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21104429: Profile (Shion version)

title: yorigami_shion
body:
[b]The Most Despicable and Disastrous Eldest Twin Sister[/b]

Main antagonist of [i][[Antinomy of Common Flowers]][/i] along with her [[sisters|sister]], [[Yorigami Jo'on]].

Being a Poverty Goddess, Shion is depicted in tatters, unlike her sister. She wears a [[hair bow]] atop her [[blue hair]]. Her hair length is ambiguous; Harukawa's portrait of her depicts her with [[long hair]] blending with her blue aura, but the in-game sprites depict her with [[short hair]]. She has [[blue eyes]]. Shion wears a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[grey hoodie]] with the [[hood down]] and a [[blue skirt]], going [[barefoot]]. She also has a black [[stuffed cat]] perched on her arm and she holds a [[damaged]] [[bowl]]. Similar to her sister, she wears [[bangle|gold bangles]]. Debt papers cover Shion's clothes and her stuffed cat. Do not confuse them with the ofuda covering Mokou's pants.

Shion is a Poverty Goddess, and stores bad luck and debts within her. As more and more is stored within her, she explodes and scatters bad luck around. Her ability allows her to possess people to reduce their luck and make them poor. Shion is usually Jo'on's cohort in her scams.

h4. Appearance

title: maribel_hearn
body:
A [[Touhou]] character (alt. spelling Maribel Han, or Maryberry Hearn; usually shortened to just Merry).

One of the main protagonists of ZUN's Music Collection. She is a psychology major living in the [[kyoto|outside world]] with the ability to see borders of any kind, including the one that separates our world from [[Gensokyo]]. She is the other member of the Hifuu Club and, together with her friend [[Usami Renko]], dedicates themselves to the secret purpose of finding a way into [[Gensokyo]].

Specializing in relative psychology, Maribel sees things more relatively and subjectively than her friend.

She usually dresses in [[purple dress|purple]] and wears a [[mob cap|white mob cap]]. Her eyes are most commonly depicted as either [[yellow eyes|yellow]] or [[purple eyes|purple]].

Due to both characters having boundary-related abilities, as well as a degree of visual resemblance, fan theories abound about a possible connection between Maribel and [[Yakumo Yukari]], with some even going so far as to suggest that they are somehow the same person - the most common theory being that Maribel somehow cast herself backwards in time and ultimately aged into Yukari as she returned to her original era "the long way". [[ZUN]]'s own comments on the pair pointed fans towards the writer [[Lafcadio Hearn]], who moved to Japan and was naturalized with the name Koizumi Yakumo.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7135426: [[Ghostly Field Club]] 
* !post #1855455: [[Neo-Traditionalism Of Japan]]

title: ganyu_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Cryo character in [[Genshin Impact]].

A half-human, half-[[qilin (mythology)|]] who serves as an emissary and secretary for the Liyue Qixing.

She has [[goat horns]], with [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[sidelocks]]. She wears a brown [[halterneck]] [[backless_outfit|backless]] [[bodystocking]] along with [[detached sleeves]] and a [[cowbell]] on her [[neck bell|neck]]. She wields [[Amos' Bow (genshin impact)|]].

Due to her resemblance to a [[goat]], a common joke involves her [[lactation|producing milk]], or other characters expecting her to do so. Since one part of the main story involves [[Qiqi (genshin impact)|]] searching for a "Cocogoat", they are frequent partners for this gag.

She is also known to [[eating flower|eat flowers]], specifically the [[qingxin flower]], since it is her favorite food.

Her name is pronounced [b]Kan'u[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

Voiced by [[Ueda Reina]] (Japanese).

title: minneapolis_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the heavy cruiser USS [i]Minneapolis[/i] (CA-36). Character designed by [[Hoshiakari (C2 Kikan)|]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[twintails]], and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]New Orleans[/i]-class uniform: a [[blue shirt]], [[black choker]], [[white ribbon|white]] [[neck ribbon]], [[grey gloves]], [[grey apron]], [[blue skirt]], [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[grey hat|grey]] [[mini hat]] patterned off her real-life bridge. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces, each with a 203 mm triple gun mount, 127 mm single pedestal mount, and [[aircraft catapult]]s; held to her back by her two funnels. In her Kai form, Minneapolis' apron gets shortened in the front, she adds an SK [[radar]] antenna on her right arm, and her rigging gains a pair of [[Oerlikon 20mm gun]] mounts. 

The damaged art of Minneapolis' base form has the detail of several [[log]]s piled up in her destroyed bow, mirroring actual damage-control measures taken by Minneapolis' crew in 1942. This is the major detail connecting Minneapolis to her Abyssal form, [[New Heavy Cruiser Princess]].

h4. Appearance

title: pyra_(xenoblade)
body:
[[Rex (xenoblade)|Rex]]'s Blade in [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]]. Known as [b]Homura[/b] in Japanese. She is one of the personalities of the Aegis, along with [[Mythra (xenoblade)|]]. Unlike Mythra, she has a sweet and amiable personality.

She has [[red hair]] in a [[short hair|short]] [[bob cut]] with [[swept bangs]], [[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[chest jewel]]. title: grand_zenith
body:
[B]Grand Zenith[/b], also referred to as [b]Zenus[/b], is a character that appears in [i][[Dragon Quest X]][/i]. He is a god responsible for the creation of the [[Galapagod]]. When in human form, he appears as a young man with long [[blonde hair]] and [[yellow eyes]].

Grand Zenith hails from a large family, being the youngest son of [[Goddess Luciana]]. His siblings are [[Nadraga]], [[Eldona (Dq10)|Eldona]], [[Sage Marine]], Pinahet, Gazbaran, and Wagi. His aunt is [[Goddess Zenesia]] and [[Raki (Dq10)|Raki]] is his uncle.

title: zion_(dqx)
body: [B]Zion[/b] is the name used for the human vessel of the [[Galapagod]] in [i][[Dragon Quest X]][/i]. He appears as a young man with [[white hair]] in formal clothing.

title: malware_(ben_10)
body: Malware was an incomplete and mutated Galvanic Mechamorph, who was one of the three main antagonists for the first two arcs in [[Ben 10: Omniverse]] along with [[Khyber]] and [[Dr. Psychobos]]. Psychotic and extremely dangerous, he helped Psychobos create the [[Nemetrix]]. His original plan was to upgrade himself with the Omnitrix to become more powerful than ever; but then evolved to destroying [[Azmuth (ben_10)|]], his allies, and all the other Galvanic Mechamorphs.

title: hypnosis_mic
body:
A rap battle music franchise by King Records and Evilline Records.

The concept surrounds groups of three rappers rap battling to gain territory for their respective divisions in a Post-World War III era. The production and/or ownership of weapons has been banned in Japan following a government coup, hence why they use [[hypnosis microphone]]s in these territory battles.

h4. Characters

All rappers have an MC name.

h6. [[Buster Bros!!!]] - Ikebukuro Division

title: captain_(honkai_impact)
body:
Captain Hyperion is the character based on the player of the game Honkai Impact 3rd. They can be male or female dependent on the player.

Unlike [[Aether (genshin Impact)|la]][[Lumine (Genshin Impact)|ter]] [[Trailblazer (Honkai: Star Rail)|playable]] [[Belle (Zenless Zone Zero)|self]]-[[Wise (Zenless Zone Zero)|insert]] characters in the Hoyoverse, he does not exist in [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s main world, being instead the protagonist of Captain's Bizarre Adventure, a secondary storyline (alternate world) in which they are the Captain of the heavy-class battleship Hyperion instead of [[Murata Himeko]] and travels across many bubble worlds in the Sea of Quanta.

The community usually portrays the Captain as a [[red hair|red-haired]] man with white [[military uniform]].

h4.See Also
* [[Murata Himeko]]

h4.External Links
https://houkai3rd.fandom.com/wiki/Captain_Hyperion

title: aether_(genshin_impact)
body:
One of the two possible protagonists in [[Genshin Impact]] and the twin brother of [[Lumine (Genshin Impact)|]]. Voiced by [[Horie Shun]] in Japanese. If chosen as the player character, he is referred to in-game by the name set by the player (as an alias/nickname) or as [b]Traveler[/b] by most people in Teyvat.

His true name is [b]Aether[/b] in English, [b]Kōng[/b] in Chinese and [b]Sora[/b] in Japanese (all three meaning 'sky'). In Teyvat, his true name is only used by his sister.

If not chosen as Player Character, he is instead the leader of the Abyss Order.



h4. Appearance

title: hifumi_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[Make-Up Work Club (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is [b]Ajitani Hifumi[/b].

Hifumi is a girl with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[low twintails]]. Hifumi has a bright [[yellow eyes]] and an average figure. Hifumi wears a standard [[white cardigan]] with [[blue sailor collar]] and [[yellow bowtie]], along with dark [[blue skirt]] and a [[black pantyhose]] and a standard [[white shoes]]. 

Usually seen with [[Peroro_(blue_archive)|]]-themed merchandise like her [[white bag|white]] [[backpack]]. Uses an [[L85]] [[assault rifle]].

In Main Stories and other events, she commandeers a [[Crusader (tank)]] known as Crusader-chan that is aware and sentient.

Voiced by: [[Hondo Kaede]]

title: hanako_(swimsuit)_(blue_archive)
body:
A [[swimsuit]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[Hanako (blue archive)|]]. Costume artist: [[mx2j]]

In this costume, Hanako's [[ahoge]] is [[huge ahoge|much larger]] compared to her standard costume. She wears simple set of [[pink bikini]] with blue outlines and strings, and an [[oversized shirt|oversized]] [[white shirt]] on top of it (likely belongs to [[Sensei (Blue Archive)|Sensei]]), and a pair of [[black sandals]]. She holds a green garden [[hose]] that's connected to an old [[hand pump]], as seen in her art and her EX-skill animation. 

Due to the peculiar way Hanako's outfit was drawn (only her [[bikini]] top is visible under her [[white shirt]]), combined with the fact that her in-game chibi model [[bikini top only|does not appear to have a bikini bottom]], this resulted in fan artists drawing Hanako in this specific outfit as being [[bottomless]].

title: hanako_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[Make-Up Work Club (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is [b]Urawa Hanako[/b].

Hanako has a [[pink hair|pink]] and [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[very long hair|thigh-long hair]] with a [[single braid]] on her right hair and an [[ahoge]] on top of it. Hanako has a [[curvy]] figure that accentuate her [[large breasts]] and thighs as seen with her other alternate costumes. She's also the only student (until [[Eri (Blue Archive)|Shirao Eri]] from Wild Hunt Academy) with a different halo position, being on her left side of her head instead of behind or on top of it.
Hanako wears the standard Trinity [[white serafuku]], albeit with [[short sleeves]] and several color changes, such as blue-and-pink outlines, [[blue sailor collar]] and a [[pink bowtie]] instead of green and yellow respectively, and she's wearing a [[white skirt]] instead of green, which is noticeably shorter.

Carries around an [[L85]] [[assault rifle]] with an attached L123A2 [[underbarrel grenade launcher]].

Voiced by: [[Toyota Moe]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]]

title: koharu_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[Make-Up Work Club (blue archive)|]] and the [[Justice Task Force (blue archive)|]]. During events of the story, she was momentarily on probation from the latter. Her full name is [b]Shimoe Koharu[/b].

Koharu holds the special distinction for being the only member of the Justice Task Force with different color scheme, replacing the red with pink instead. Koharu has a [[pink hair|pink]] [[medium hair]] with [[low twintails]]. She has the standard [[black wings|black]] and tiny [[low wings]] in addition to her black [[head wings]]. One of her interesting characteristic is a conspicuous line (tattoo possibly?) that's stretches from just under her head all the way to her crotch, which can be seen in her Swimsuit Costume.
She wears a different style of her Justice Task Force uniform, being a [[black cardigan]] instead of a serafuku, which worn improperly to expose [[single bare shoulder|one of her shoulder]]. Her sailor collar is [[white sailor collar|white]] instead of the usual black, she also wears a dark [[pink skirt]] and a [[white socks|white]] [[loose socks]]. She also wears the JTF standard issue [[black hat|black]] [[beret]], the only part of the JTF uniform that's left unaltered.

Lugs around a [[p14_enfield|Pattern 1914 Enfield]] [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] wrapped in cloth.

Voiced by: [[Akao Hikaru]]
Original artist: [[DoReMi_(doremi4704)]]

h4. Appearance

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and [[green eyes]] with [[paw-shaped pupils]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[dianzi]], [[green dress]] with [[detached sleeves]], [[brown belt]], [[loose socks|loose]] [[white socks]], and dark [[blue shoes]]. title: onii-chan_wa_oshimai!
body:
A TS comedy manga series about a boy transformed into a girl by his little sister's strange drugs. Written and illustrated by [[Nekotoufu]].

Initially serialized online and in doujinshi in 2017 (pool #12768), Ichijinsha began publishing the work in print in 2018, and in 2019 it began serialization in the Monthly Comic Rex magazine. Kodansha USA has licensed the English version and is publishing it under the title "ONIMAI: I'm Now Your Sister!". An anime TV series adaptation premiered in January 2023. 

In the official media, almost all characters have [[tareme]] by default. In the anime, all characters have [[bright pupils]] and many have [[streaked hair]] and [[colored inner hair]].

h4. Characters

* [[Oyama Mahiro]]

title: jintsuu_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Jintsuu[/i]. Character design by [[Jianren]], voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], and animalistic [[animal ears|ears]] and [[tail]]. She wears a mix of traditional [[Japanese clothes]] with a white [[pleated skirt]]. She is also shown to be holding a [[folding fan]] (two at retrofit). Her [[rigging]] at base form contains two 14 cm single mounts, one on each side.

For her retrofit form, see her [[jintsuu (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]

title: ayase_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Ayase[/i], the fifth of the [i]Sendai[/i]-class. Voiced by [[Aizawa Saya]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]]s, [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] style composed of a [[white kimono]] with a [[white sailor collar]] and [[white neckerchief|neckerchief]], [[wide sleeves]], [[red skirt|red]] [[hakama short skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[black footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two separate hull pieces held by [[shimenawa]] to her back, containing two 14 cm [[cannon|gun]] mounts and 61 cm twin [[torpedo tubes]] per side and fashioned with [[jingle bell]]s and [[shide]]. 

Intended as the fifth of the class, she and four other members were cancelled to comply with the Washington Naval Treaty.

title: noa_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. She serves as the secretary for Millennium's student council, [[Seminar (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is [b]Ushio Noa[/b]. 

Noa has a [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair|silver hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and wears a mechanical [[headphones]] that resembles the typical anime [[robot ears]], a leftover of her old character draft by [[hwansang]] where she was originally supposed to be an [[android]] wielding a large railgun instead, until it was scrapped and the idea was reintroduced with the character  [[Aris (Blue Archive)|Tendou Aris]].
Noa wears identical outfit to [[Yuuka (Blue Archive)|Yuuka]], even wearing the same [[white jacket]] that's worn by every other Seminar members sans [[Rio (Blue Archive)|Rio]], except with the colors reversed and she wears a [[black pantyhose]] instead of showing her thighs like Yuuka does.

She wields a modified [[SIG SAUER P320|]] [[handgun]] based on "Tokyo Marui":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Marui]'s Hi-CAPA Xtreme .45 with a carbine conversion kit.

Often the subject of offshoots of the [[gomen yui]] meme ("[[gomen yuuka]]").

Voiced by: [[Suzushiro Sayumi]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]] (original design)/[[DoReMi]] (in-game art)

h4. Appearance

* !post #5708857: Default
* !post #9468792: [[noa (pajamas) (blue archive)|Pajamas]]

* [[Gomen Yuuka]]
