title: hoshino_terror_(blue_archive)
body:
An alternate version of [[Blue Archive]]'s [[Hoshino (blue archive)|]]. [spoiler]Her transformation into a "Terror" form was not triggered by exposure to the Chroma, but rather the compounding trauma and guilt of her past pushing her to a despair-filled breaking point. Unlike Shiroko*Terror, her transformation is incomplete and can be reversed somewhat. Even at incomplete transformation she's much more destructive than Shiroko*Terror, capable of destroying the entirety of Kivotos if she ever clashes with Fury of Set.[/spoiler]

In this alternate version of Hoshino, her entire being is engulfed in darkness with scorching [[pink fire]] as a [spoiler]manifestation of her powers[/spoiler]. Her hair is [[short hair|cut short]] and her [[huge ahoge]] is also omitted. She wears a [[black shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] as well as [[black skirt|black]] [[high-low skirt]] with [[black pantyhose]] and a distinct [[black shoes]]. There's a glowing [[rectangular halo|rectangular]] [[pink halo]] around her chest that resembles [spoiler]Yume's missing notebook[/spoiler], which was the source of her anguish [spoiler]after her untimely death years ago, something that she's been searching for as a way to cope with her loss[/spoiler]. This notebook-shaped halo is the hint [spoiler]that her transformation can still be reversed.[/spoiler]

title: scared
body:
A character who is in an emotional state of fear.

This can be used in either a humorous or serious fashion. Characteristics include [[trembling]], wide eyes, [[tears]], [[cowering]], and in extreme cases, contracted pupils and a general sense of great danger approaching the character.

For jumpy, sudden scares (such as "BOO!" moments), use the [[surprised]] tag.

title: lillie_(pokemon)
body:
A character from [[Pokemon|Pokémon]], introduced in [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[green eyes]]. She's often depicted with her companion [[Pokemon (creature)|Pokemon]], [[Cosmog]].

She has two official outfits. The first includes a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] and [[white boots|white]] [[knee boots]]. It also sometimes includes a [[white hat|white]] [[sun hat]] and a [[Poke ball theme|Poké ball-themed]] [[duffel bag]]. 

The second outfit includes a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] and a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[white skirt]], along with [[white shoes|white]] [[mary janes]]. She also sometimes wears a [[pink bag|pink]] [[backpack]].

Her hair is sometimes worn in a [[ponytail with braided base|ponytail with a braided base]].

Her family includes [[Gladion (pokemon)|]], who is her brother, as well as [[Lusamine (pokemon)|]] and [[Mohn (pokemon)|]], who are her mother and father respectively.

h4. Appearance

title: neopolitan_(rwby)
body:
Villain from [[rwby|RWBY]]. The right-hand woman of [[Roman Torchwick]], with whom she shares an obvious love of trolling. She fights with an [[umbrella]], uses illusions solid enough to shatter like glass when struck, and doesn't speak aloud (but does have a voice actress). Her backstory is fleshed out in the tie-in novel [i]RWBY: Roman Holiday[/i], where her birth name is revealed to be Trivia Vanille.

Neo has [[pink_hair|pink]], [[brown_hair|brown]], and [[white_hair|white]] [[multicolored hair]] to match her namesake [[Neapolitan ice cream]]; her eyes can also change between [[pink_eyes|pink]], [[brown_eyes|brown]], and/or [[white_eyes|white]] in any combination (with or without [[heterochromia]], and in different orders).  At 4'9'' in [[high heels]], Neo is the shortest humanoid character in the series — [[Yang Xiao Long|Yang]] is a full head taller.

title: xuan-yuan_sword
body: Xuan-Yuan Sword (Chinese: 軒轅劍, literally "Sword of the Xuan-Yuan") is a long-running historical fantasy role-playing video game series developed for personal computers by the DOMO Studio (DOMO小組/多魔小組) of the Taiwanese game developer Softstar Entertainment. The games incorporate heavily elements of Chinese mythology, and is one of the so-called "Twin Swords of Softstar" (大宇雙劍) along with The Legend of Sword and Fairy, a sister fantasy RPG series also developed by Softstar.

title: sage_(marvel)
body:
Sage, real name Teresia Karisik, is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[Marvel]] Comics. She has most often been associated with the [[X-Men]] and the Hellfire Club, whom she spied upon under the alias Tessa for [[Charles Xavier]].

A mutant, Sage possesses a number of mental abilities and was presented as the personal assistant to the Hellfire Club's [[Sebastian Shaw]], but an extended retcon revealed that she was one of the first mutants discovered by Charles Xavier. She has been a member of the original X-Men teams, Excalibur, the Exiles, X-Force, and a cross-dimensional X-Men team similar to the Exiles known as the X-Treme X-Men. 

Sage appears in the television series The Gifted played by Hayley Lovitt.

title: bishoujo_senshi_sailor_moon_crystal
body:
A summer 2014 adaptation of the [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] franchise, commemorating the series' 20th anniversary. Sailor Moon Crystal isn't a remake of the previous 1992-1997 series. Rather, it is more faithful to the manga's storyline. The first two arcs, the Dark Kingdom and Black Moon arcs, aired from July 2014 to July 2015. The third arc, Death Busters, aired in 2016. The fourth arc, Dead Moon, was released as a two-part film in 2021. The fifth and final arc, Shadow Galactica, was likewise released as a two-part film in 2023.

This tag is to be used if there is a direct reference to BSSMC such as a [[voice actor connection]], an artist using the [[official style]], or depicting a scene that happens in the show.

h4.Voice actors

* [[Aino Minako]]/[[Sailor Venus]] - [[Itou Shizuka]]
* [[Chibi Usa]]/[[Sailor Chibi Moon]] - [[Fukuen Misato]]
* [[Hino Rei]]/[[Sailor Mars]] - [[Satou Rina]]
* [[Kaiou Michiru]]/[[Sailor Neptune]] - [[Oohara Sayaka]]
* [[Kino Makoto]]/[[Sailor Jupiter]] - [[Koshimizu Ami]]
* [[Meiou Setsuna]]/[[Sailor Pluto]] - [[Maeda Ai]]

title: bishoujo_senshi_sailor_moon_s
body:
The third season of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]], encompassing the [i]Infinity[/i] arc of the manga, the third season of the 90s anime, and the second season of [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon crystal|Crystal]], running for 13 episodes. [[Sailor Uranus]], [[Sailor Neptune]] and [[Sailor Saturn]] are introduced in this season, and this is the first time that Sailor Moon becomes [[Super Sailor Moon]]. The meaning behind the [i]S[/i] subtitle is [i]Super[/i], as the season's eyecatch has a woman calling out the phrase, "Sailor Moon Super". It also has a follow-up feature length movie, with [[Luna (sailor moon)|]] gaining her one-time [[luna (sailor moon) (human)|human form]] here. [[Itou Ikuko]] and [[Tominaga Mari]] are the primary official artists for the 90s anime's [i]S[/i] season, while [[Takahashi Akira]] is the artist for [i]Crystal[/i].

Use this tag only for artwork, characters, forms, items, and events that appear exclusively in this season.

title: bishoujo_senshi_sailor_moon_stars
body:
The fifth season of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]], encompassing the [i]Stars[/i] arc of the manga, the fifth season of the 90s anime subtitled [i]Sailor Stars[/i], and the fourth season for [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon crystal|Crystal]], subtitled [i]Cosmos[/i]. In the 90s anime, only Sailor Moon gets an upgrade into [[Eternal Sailor Moon]], while the [[Inner Senshi]] remain in their Super forms and the [[Outer Senshi]] gain their own Super forms. In the manga and Crystal, all of Earth's Sailor Senshi gain an 'Eternal' form. [[Tamegai Katsumi]] and [[Shimogasa Miho]] are the primary official artists for the 90s anime's [i]Stars[/i] season, while [[Takahashi Akira]] is the artist for [i]Cosmos[/i].

title: bishoujo_senshi_sailor_moon_supers
body:
Stylized as [i]Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon SuperS[/i]. The fourth season of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]], encompassing the [i]Dream[/i] arc of the manga, the fourth season of the 90s anime, and the third season of [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon crystal|Crystal]], subtitled [i]Eternal[/i]. The 90s anime has a follow-up feature length movie, and is the last one produced. Note that while the [[Amazons Quartet]] appear again in the manga and Crystal's [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon stars|final season]], they are actually [[Sailor Senshi]] corrupted by the Dead Moon Circus, so their villainous counterparts are treated as part of this season. [[Itou Ikuko]] and [[Tominaga Mari]] are the primary official artists for the 90s anime's [i]SuperS[/i] season, while [[Takahashi Akira]] is the artist for [i]Eternal[/i].

title: bishoujo_senshi_sailor_moon_r
body:
The second season of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]], encompassing the [i]Black Moon[/i] arc of the manga, the second season of the 90s anime, and the later 12 episodes of [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon crystal|Crystal]]'s first 26 episodes. [[Chibi Usa]] and [[Sailor Pluto]] are introduced in this season. The meaning behind the [i]R[/i] subtitle is ambiguous, being either [i]Romance[/i], [i]Return[/i], or [i]Rose[/i]. The 90s anime breaks this season into two parts; the Makai Tree arc, and the Black Moon Clan arc. It also has a follow-up feature length movie. [[Tadano Kazuko]] and [[Itou Ikuko]] are the primary official artists for the 90s anime's [i]R[/i] season, while [[Sakou Yukie]] is the artist for [i]Crystal[/i].

title: gyan_(gquuuuuux)
body:
A fictional manned [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It appears in [[gundam gquuuuuux|Mobile Suit Gundam GQuuuuuX]].

[b]MS-15 GYAN[/b]

GQuuuuuX's version of the [[Gyan]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] produced by [[Zeon]]. [[Xavier Olivette]]'s model comes equipped with Hakuji, a [[lance]] that also serves as a booster and a [[beam cannon]].

Some otaku would see some similarity in the Gyan's design with [[Ultraseven (series)|]]'s [[Windom]].

title: lumine_(genshin_impact)
body:
One of the two possible protagonists in [[Genshin Impact]], and the [[twins|twin]] [[brother and sister|sister]] of [[Aether (Genshin Impact)|]]. Voiced by [[Yuuki Aoi]] in Japanese.

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[short hair with long locks|long locks]] and [[hair flower]]s. She wears a [[white dress|white]], [[high-low dress|high-low]] [[halter dress]] with a [[white overskirt|white]] [[overskirt]], a [[collared cape]], and [[white boots|white]] [[thigh boots]].

Her name is [b]Lumine[/b] in English, [b]Yíng[/b] (荧, meaning "luminous") in Chinese and [b]Hotaru[/b] (蛍, meaning "firefly") in Japanese. In Teyvat, her true name is only used by her brother. She is often paired with [[Firefly (honkai: star rail)|]] from [[Honkai: Star Rail]], whose name is also localized as "Hotaru" in Japanese.

If chosen as the player character, she is referred to in-game by the name set by the player or as [b]Traveler[/b] by most people in Teyvat. If not chosen as the player character, she is instead the leader of the Abyss Order.


h4. Appearance

* !post #4801442: Profile

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Traveler":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Traveler]

title: isolde_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Isolde[/b] is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]. She is an opera singer that can channel the spirits of the dead to give her performances authenticity. She is the friend of [[Kakania (Reverse:1999)|]].

[spoiler]She is revealed to be a member of Manus Vindictae, helping them assassinate important figures of her era, in order to bring about World War 1. In the end, she is captured by The Foundation, but she enters a delusional state due to PTSD, thinking she is still in Vienna. [/spoiler]

She is voiced by Ella Jonas Farlinger in English and [[Asakura Azumi]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance

title: choukou_tenshi_escalayer
body:
A eroge about a sex-powered superheroine, created by [[ALICESOFT]] in 2002. It was adapted into an OVA series in the same year. A remake, titled [i]Chouko Tenshi Escalayer Reboot[/i], was released in 2014, which was localized by MangaGamer as [i]Beat Angel Escalayer R[/i] in 2020.

title: molly_hale
body:
[b]Molly Hale[/b] is a character from the [[pokemon|Pokémon]] franchise, specifically the third theatrical film, [[Pokemon 3: The Movie - Spell Of The Unown: Entei|Pokémon 3: The Movie - Spell of the Unown: Entei]].

In the film, Molly is a grieving girl who recently lost her father in an archeological accident, kidnapping [[Delia Ketchum]] with the help of Unown and the newly-born Entei as a way of coping with her loss, prompting [[Ash Ketchum]] to pursuit Entei and save his mother.

On the outside, Molly seems to be arrogant, cruel and selfish who only cares for herself, but deep down she is a kind-hearted young girl who loves her father and does care for her friends, she is also shown to be very remorseful after she realized what she has done.

Despite her young age, Molly is also shown to be brave, such as not being scared of Entei when he first appears and instead recognizes him as her "Papa".

Molly is a young girl who has [[blue eyes]], fair skin and [[blonde hair|blondish]]-[[brown hair|brunette hair]] while her outfit consists of a [[blue dress]] and [[blue bow|bow]]: her attire and hair change when she [[age progression|alters her age]]. In her [[child|true age]], she has [[short hair]] and her bow is on the left side of her head. Her dress is paired with a white [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] shirt and [[blue gemstone|blue gem]] and [[pink shoes]] with white [[kneehighs|knee-high socks]] .

As a pre-teen, her hair [[long hair|reaches to the bottom of her neck]], her shirt is now [[sleeveless]] while her dress no longer has lines on it and her shoes are replaced with light [[brown boots]].

As a teenager, Molly's hair has [[big hair|grown much larger]] in addition to becoming a lighter blonde and [[absurdly long hair|reaches her shoulders]], her dress is a darker shade of blue with a white coat-like [[cape]] over it, her bow is worn on her neck and she doesn't wear socks while her boots have become a darker shade of brown. In addition, Molly's voice becomes lower and more mature sounding. She also wears a pair of black-and-white, yo-yo themed [[earrings]].

title: arcana_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Arcana[/b] is the main antagonist of [[Reverse:1999]]. She is the leader of Manus Vindictae, an extremist group that want to establish a society with only arcanists.

She has [[blue hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. She wears [[black dress]] with [[black gloves]], and a [[wand]] that goes through her head.

She is voiced by Naomi McDonald in English and [[Koshimizu Ami]] in Japanese.

title: 37_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]37[/b] is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]. She is a member of Apeiron, an all-arcanist society that practices Pythagoreanism and believes all is explained by numbers, including themselves. Obsessed with that belief, 37 is indifferent to the material world, and only cares about numbers and shape of forms. She was gifted that she can accurately predict someone's exact number. She is a friend of [[Sophia (Reverse:1999)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]], and wears [[ancient greek clothes]].

She is voiced by Emily Stranges in English and [[Iguchi Yuka]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance

title: crelly_parfait
body:
An English-speaking [[cow girl]] [[Indie Virtual Youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. 

Her original model had shoulder-length [[pink hair]], two [[small horns]], spotted [[cow ears]], a [[cow tail]], a gold [[cowbell]], a [[pink shirt]], [[blue shorts]], a [[jacket]], and [[white stockings]]. She also had a [[goth fashion|goth]] model with larger horns, [[purple hair]], a [[pink shirt|pink top]], a silver bell with a [[heart]] in the middle. [[multiple tails|two tails]], a [[torn skirt|torn]] [[black skirt]], and [[torn thighhighs|torn]] [[black thighhighs|black stockings]].

Her current model has shoulder-length [[green hair]], two small horns, a [[frilled skirt|ruffled]] [[button up skirt]], a gold cowbell, a long [[brown coat]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], and a [[messenger bag]] at her side. She has [[heterochromia]], with one [[red eyes|red eyes]] with a [[grey sclera]] and one [[white eyes|white eye]] with a [[black sclera]].

title: bb_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. She appears in [[Fate/Extra CCC]] and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Appearance-wise, she looks like [[Matou Sakura]], with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

In [[Fate/Extra CCC]], she is an advanced AI created by [[Matou Sakura (fate/extra)|]]. She is also the Master of the Sakura Five: [[Passionlip (fate)|]], [[Meltryllis (fate)|]], [[Kazuradrop (fate)|]], [[Violet (fate)|]], and [[Kingprotea (fate)|]].

[spoiler]Originally created as a friendly AI to aid masters who participatied in the lunar Holy Grail War. Due to a glitch in her coding, she has developed sadistic tendencies and later took over the Moon's electrical system. She often pretends to aid the players, only to put them in her own trap and mocking them of how powerless they are.[/spoiler]

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], she is a MoonCancer-class welfare Servant for the [[SE.RA.PH (fate/grand order)|Fate/Extra CCC event]].

title: bb_dubai_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order|]] character introduced in [[Celeb Summer Experience!]]. She is an AI from an alternate timeline originally known as [b]Last Slot[/b] acting as the admin of Moon Dubai. She ended up taking the appearance and personality of [[BB (fate)|]] upon determining it to be optimal as an administrative AI. She hijacks the annual summer event to create the [[Archetype Inception (fate/grand order)|]] Ordeal Call. [spoiler]She later fuses with [[BB Cosmo (fate)|]] to create [[Golden BB (fate)|]].[/spoiler]

As a servant, she makes up the first ascension of the servant, with [[BB Cosmo (fate)|]] making up her second. Their [[Golden BB (fate)|third ascension]] is locked until players complete [[Archetype Inception (fate/grand order)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]

title: amamiya_(sakusei_byoutou)
body:
Dr. Amamiya is the doctor who produces producing highly potent drugs with her assistant [[Ootsuka (Sakusei Byoutou)|Ootsuka]]. 

Characterized with a very [[open mouth]] and loud speech in the series.

[spoiler]She had her research funding frozen due to her illegal and dangerous drugs until Mako took over the hospital.

The drugs she makes are also sold to criminal organizations.
 [/spoiler]

title: ootsuka_(sakusei_byoutou)
body: Amamiya's assistant in manufacturing drugs.

title: tendou_mia_(sakusei_byoutou)
body:
Younger sister of the head nurse,[[Tendou Mako (Sakusei Byoutou)|Tendou Mako]] at the hospital. 

She has a very low mental age and refers to herself in third person. She treats her patients and juniors like playthings and acts without any fear of consequences.

It is later revealed she [spoiler]is under the heavy influence of drugs for most of the series to make her "happy".[/spoiler]

title: melon_bread
body:
A sweet crispy [[bread]], so called because its appearance resembles a [[melon]]. It traditionally does not have melon flavoring, although some manufacturers may add melon flavoring when desired. There are also many variations depending on the additional ingredients. Not limited to Japan, it is also found in Latin America as a variant of pan dulce. 

Trademark food of [[Shana]]; if shown with a character who shares her [[Kugimiya Rie|voice actress]], it becomes an instant [[voice actor connection]]. 

Not to be confused with [[pineapple bun]], a similar looking bread.

h4. See also

* [[bread eating race]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Melonpan":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melonpan

title: philippine_scouts
body:
A military organization of the [[United States Army]] from 1901 until after the end of World War II composed of Filipinos and Filipino-Americans under the command of American commissioned officers.  Their shoulder sleeve insignia from 1921–1947 was the head of the carabao symbolizing the [[Philippines]]. The colors red and gold represented the islands' Spanish colonial roots.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Philippine Scouts":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippine_Scouts]

title: independence_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the US Navy light aircraft carrier USS [i]Independence[/i] (CVL-22). 
Character design by [[Atdan]], voiced by [[Yamazaki Haruka]].

In-game, she is depicted with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied in a [[low ponytail]], with [[red eyes]]. She wears a sleeveless [[grey jacket]], [[black skirt]], [[blue coat]], [[red gloves]], tricolor (mostly blue) [[thighhighs]], and red [[rudder footwear]].
She is also shown holding a large [[bow (weapon)|]] and a [[quiver]], with her real-life bridge, crane, and spliced flight deck integral with the bow.

h4. Appearance

* [[Independence (Transfer Student From Afar) (Azur Lane)|Transfer Student From Afar]]

title: degenbrecher_(arknights)
body:
[i]Guard Operator Degenbrecher, forever stood behind you.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Leithanien[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]June 6[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Caprinae[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]182 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]25 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Formerly known as "Black Knight" who has an outstanding physical ability but unable to use Originium Arts, the three-time champion of the Kazimierz Major.

After she won the third match she was supposed to lose, she has become  a threat to the General Chamber of Commerce's interests,
only to be hired by [[silverash_(arknights)|Enciodes]], and become a bodyguard in Karlan Trading Co.
Joined Rhodes Island as an operator via indefinite contract.

Debut as the final boss in the side story [i]Break the Ice[/i], and become a playable character in the side story [i]The Rides to Lake Silbernherze[/i].

Her [[voice actor|voice actors]] are [[Takayama Minami]] (JP), Wu Di (CN-Mandarin), Nina-Mercedés Rühl (EN), and Lim Yoon-seon (KR). Her art designer is [[Ryuuzaki Ichi]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #4994523: Default
* !post #8422566: [[degenbrecher (the shadow of the dark moon) (arknights)|The Shadow of the Dark Moon]]

title: rowdyruff_boys
body: The Rowdyruff Boys are major antagonists in the [[Powerpuff Girls]] franchise. They are the male but wicked versions of the Powerpuff Girls created by [[Mojo Jojo]] in a prison toilet. The group is made up of [[Brick (Ppg)|]] ([[Blossom_(ppg)|]]'s counterpart), [[Boomer_(ppg)|]] ([[Bubbles_(ppg)|]]'s counterpart), and [[Butch_(ppg)|]] ([[Buttercup (Ppg)|]]'s counterpart). [spoilers]After being killed by the Powerpuff Girls, they were resurrected by [[Him_(powerpuff Girls)|]], and began to sport notably meaner appearances.[/spoilers]

title: suzuran_(arknights)
body:
[i]Suzuran, Rhodes Island Operator, has nine times the strength, and the fluffiness.[/i]

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Lisa

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Higashi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 9[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vulpo[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]137 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A child prodigy under the guidance of [[Kal'tsit (Arknights)|]] while receiving treatment at Rhodes Island. After she decided to apply to Rhodes Island, she was approved to participate in some low-difficulty tasks under the supervision of other operators.

One of the protagonists of the side story event [i]Twilight of Wolumonde[/i].

Her motif is based on the mythical [[kyuubi|nine-tailed]] [[kitsune|fox]]. Her callsign is [[object namesake|derived]] from the Japanese name of the flower, [i][[lily of the valley]][/i]. Her mother is [[Vulpisfoglia (Arknights)|Vulpisfoglia]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Hondo Kaede]]. Her illustrator is [[sho_(sho_lwlw)|]].

body:
A series of Filipino comic books created by Filipino writer Mars Ravelo and originally illustrated by Filipino artist Nestor Redondo, starring the eponymous [[darna|superheroine]]. 

It has been adapted into multiple movies and TV series in the Philippines.

title: valentina_(darna)
body:
A supervillainness who is the archnemesis of the Filipino superheroine [[Darna]]. 

Among Darna's rogues' gallery, Valentina is the most popular. She is also the most famous Filipino supervillain character, just like her archnemesis Darna being the most famous Filipino superhero character. 

Valentina has a Gorgon-like appearance due to her signature [[snake hair]] (in fact, some Filipino fans who are unfamiliar with the Gorgons from Greek mythology may associate other fictional characters having snake hair as a reference to Valentina instead). Depending on the series and adaptations, she may possess other snake-like traits, such as having [[slit pupils]], a [[forked tongue]], [[scales|scaled skin]], [[fangs]], and a venomous bite (either from her fangs, her snake hair, or both).

title: narda_(darna)
body:
The human alter-ego of the Filipino superheroine [[Darna]].

Depending on the series or adaptation, Narda may be either a similar or a separate character from Darna. Also, she can either be a young girl, a teenager or an adult woman.

Her name is an anagram of her superheroine alter-ego's. Narda also has a younger brother named Ding.

title: darna
body:
The eponymous superheroine and main protagonist of the Filipino comic book series [[Darna (series)|]], which has been adapted into multiple movies and TV series in the [[Philippines]]. 

She is the superheroine alter-ego of a young girl or woman named [[Narda (Darna)|]]. And depending on the adaptation or comic book universe, they can either be the same or separate characters from each other. 

To transform into Darna, Narda swallows a pebble-sized magic white stone (with Darna's name engraved onto it. That is how she learned the superheroine's name) first and then shouts her superheroine alter-ego's name. To change back into Narda, Darna shouts her human alter-ego's name instead and after changing back, Narda regurgitates the white stone she swallowed. 

Darna's [[superhero costume]]s follow a specific but iconic design (though those has some minor differences from other series or adaptations): she usually wears a red [[bikini]] (with either a [[strapless bra]] or [[strapless bikini]] top) or shorts with a gold star in each [[bra|brassiere]] cup; red [[helmet]] with a gold winged, [[v-fin]]-like, medallion on its center (the medallion may or may not be encrusted with [[red gemstone|ruby]]); gold bracelets; a golden medallion belt with a loincloth in the middle; and red boots. 

Darna's superpowers are mostly similar to [[Superman]]'s, such as super strength, super speed, flight, super senses, and nigh invulnerability. In some versions, if the gold winged medallion on her helmet has a ruby encrusted onto it, she can use it as a powerful weapon by firing a red laser [[beam]] from it. 

Darna is widely considered as a Filipino cultural icon and the most celebrated superhero character in the Philippines.

title: regina_(darna)
body: The human alter-ego of [[Valentina (Darna)|Valentina]] from the 2022 TV series adaptation of [[Darna (series)|]], a famous Filipino comic book series.

title: snow_white_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of the [[Pioneer (nikke)|]] squad along with [[Scarlet (Nikke)|Scarlet]] and [[Rapunzel (Nikke)|Rapunzel]]. A puritanical pilgrim who wanders the surface in an effort to protect humanity. As a member of Pioneer, her days are spent wiping out Raptures with extreme prejudice. [spoiler] Because of the lack of food on the surface, she forced herself to survive by eating spoiled [[field ration]]s, and has become quite fixated on any food she can find.[/spoiler]

Like all members of Pioneer, Snow White and her weapons are references from the [[Snow White (fairy tale)|German fairy tale of the same name]].

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[white hair|white]] [[long hair]]. She's a [[mecha musume]] with a [[single mechanical arm]]. She wears a [[visor (armor)]], a [[white cloak]], has [[dog tags]], [[shoulder armor]] and [[armored boots]]. Usually carries a [[assault rifle]] and a [[sniper rifle]].

h4. Appearance

title: alec_guinness
body:
Sir Alec Guinness (born Alec Guinness de Cuffe; 2 April 1914 – 5 August 2000) was an English actor. In the BFI listing of the 100 most important British films of the 20th century.
He portrayed [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] in George Lucas's original [[Star Wars]] trilogy.

body:

Portrayed as an old man (known as Ben Kenobi) by the late Sir [[Alec Guinness]], and in his youth by [[Ewan McGregor]].

In this costume, Hoshino wears a simple [[white bikini|white]] [[frilled bikini]] and a simple [[blue jacket]]. She also has a [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear on head|on top of her head]]. She's almost always seen with her whale-shaped floatie as seen in the character art.

Do not use this tag if Hoshino is wearing a school swimsuit; use [[abydos high school swimsuit]] instead. Also check if the post depicts Hoshino's [[Hoshino (First Year) (Blue Archive)|alternate first-year design]], as this is the version of Hoshino who canonically wears the Abydos High School swimsuit.

title: shiroko_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Field captain of the [[Foreclosure Task Force (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is [b]Sunaookami Shiroko[/b].

Her firearm is a [[SIG 556]] [[assault rifle]] with a [[sig p220/p226|SIG P226]] as a sidearm. She also utilizes a custom made [[drone]] with missile pods that you can see in her EX-skill animation.

Shiroko is a [[wolf girl]] with [[grey hair|grey]] [[medium hair]] and [[extra ears|two sets of ears]]; a pair of [[wolf ears]] and a pair of human ears like other [[kemonomimi mode|kemonomimi]] students. Shiroko wears the standard Abydos [[school uniform]] that comprised of [[white shirt]] and [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]] with checkered patterns, as well as the standard dark [[blue jacket]] that she [[open jacket|left open]] to reveal her standard issue [[blue necktie]]. She wears her trademark [[blue scarf]] around her neck as well as her [[green gloves|green biking gloves]] that you can see in her other costumes. She also wears a [[cross hair ornament|cross-shaped hair ornament]] on her left hair.

Voiced by: [[Ogura Yui]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]]

title: vulpisfoglia_(arknights)
body:
[i]Former famiglia assassin Vulpisfoglia, now a Vanguard Operator, has just completed a task she had to see through.[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real name: Ingrid Venezia

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Siracusa[/td][/tr]

      [td]161 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]25 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Former assassin of Famiglia Venezia, one of the mafia families in Siracusa.
After she was separated herself from her famiglia for various reasons, 
she now works at Rhodes Island as an Operator.

Her daughter, [[Suzuran (Arknights)|]] is also Operator in Rhodes Island, and [[suzuran's_father_(arknights)|Her husband]] is the priest from Higashi.

One of the main characters in the side story [i]I Portatori dei Velluti[/i].

Her motif is based on [[Fennec fox]]. Her callsign is an Italian name for Alopecurus (foxtail weed).

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Mitsuishi Kotono]] (JP), Jin Miao'er (CN), Chiara Preziosi (EN), Jeon Hae-ri (KR), and Virginia Astarita (IT).
Her illustrator is [[Sho (sho lwlw)|]].

h4. Appearance

title: neuvillette_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable [[Genshin Impact]] character released in Version 4.1. Voiced by [[Kamiya Hiroshi]]. The Chief Justice of Fontaine, known as the Iudex, and second-in-command to the Hydro Archon, [[Furina_(genshin_impact)|]]. 

He is depicted with [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and styled in a [[low-tied_long_hair|low-tied]] [[ponytail]], and [[blue eyes|blue]] [[tsurime]] eyes, giving him a sharp appearance. His default (and only) outfit consists of a [[black coat]], [[black capelet|black]]-[[blue capelet]], a [[white ascot]], [[black shirt]], [[black pants]], [[black gloves]], and [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]] with [[thighhigh gaiters]]. Because of their similarities in appearance, he’s often associated with the [[Leisurely Otter (genshin impact)|]]. His true identity though is the incumbent Hydro Dragon Sovereign. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #6591396: Profile


h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Neuvillette":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Neuvillette]

title: trojan_green_asteroid
body:
Japanese name: 鳥船遺跡 ～ Trojan Green Asteroid

The 6th music CD from Team Shanghai Alice, a part of the [[Touhou]] side series "ZUN's Music Collection".

Was released on the 30th of April 2012, during COMIC1☆6.

This album tells the story of the Hifuu club members [[Usami_Renko|Renko]] and [[Maribel_Hearn|Maribel]] travelling to the fictional [[torifune (touhou)|TORIFUNE]] satellite. Use this tag for artworks depicting the locations or events from the album.

body: Squirrel and Hedgehog (Korean: [b]다람이와 고슴도치[/b], [i]Daramiwa Goseumdochi[/i]) is a North Korean animated series produced by SEK Studio (aka April 26 Animation Studio). The show began with a 1977 pilot and ran intermittently through 2012; it has been re-aired since 2023, and North Korean state media reported a new series entering production in 2025.

title: confrontation
body:
Two characters or group who are hostile to each other are facing each other in the image, typically with an [[eye contact]] or with their weapons ready.

title: seinfeld
body:
Seinfeld is an American television sitcom created by Larry David and [[Jerry Seinfeld]]. It aired on NBC from July 5, 1989, to May 14, 1998, for nine seasons consisting of 180 episodes. The show's ensemble cast stars Seinfeld as a fictionalized version of himself and focuses on his personal life with three of his friends: best friend [[George Costanza]] (Jason Alexander), former girlfriend [[Elaine Benes]] (Julia Louis-Dreyfus), and neighbor from across the hall, [[Cosmo Kramer]] ([[Michael Richards]]).

h4. See Also

title: help:glossary
body:
h4. Introduction

In here you will find the meaning behind most of the terms Danbooru users use. This also covers terms of other sites relevant to Danbooru.

h4. Dictionary

h5. User actions

* [b]1up[/b] - When a better version of an existing post is uploaded, especially if the existing version hadn't been approved yet and ends up deleted because the new one was better. It was commonly seen with Pixiv posts 1upping Twitter posts back when Twitter reduced the quality of images.

* [b]Gardening[/b] - Curating items by adding/removing/changing data, this term is usually applied to any edit action done in bulk, such as on:
** "artists":/artists
** "artist commentaries":/artist_commentaries
** "notes":/notes
** "pools":/notes
** "posts":/posts - This includes edit actions on posts other than adding/removing tags.
** "tags":/tags - Adding them to posts that should contain them, or removing them from posts that shouldn't.
** "wiki pages":/wiki_pages

* [b]Sniping[/b] - When someone uploads an artwork with few tags in an effort to be the first uploader. This is usually frowned upon.

* [b]Mintagging[/b] - Tagging an upload with the bare minimum of tags or below; usually associated with sniping, but can also be a sign of laziness, which is also frowned upon.

* [b]Nuke[/b] - Completely deleting a tag, usually done through a BUR.

h5. Users

* [b]Unres[/b] (short for unrestricted) - Users at the Contributor user level or above, able to upload while bypassing the [[about:mod queue|moderation queue]] entirely. The opposite of this is [b]Res[/b]tricted, meaning someone below Contributor level. ([[Help:Users]]).

* [b]Gold+[/b] - a short way of saying "Gold level or higher"

* [b]Approver[/b] - Users who are able to approve (set as active, preventing them from being automatically deleted) posts, often nicknamed Janitors ([[Help:Users]]). 

* [b]Moderator[/b] - Users at the Moderator+ levels, who moderate the actions of users ([[Help:Users]]). Be aware that many of the people who approve/disapprove posts are Approvers but are not Moderators.

* [b]Platinum-[/b] - A short way of saying "Platinum level or lower"

* See [[help:users]] for a list of the different levels.

h5. Posts

* [b]Appeal[/b] - If you think a deleted post is undeserving of deletion, you can appeal it ([[Howto:appeal]]).

* [b]Blacklist[/b] - Danbooru hides posts if they contain a tag from your blacklist ([[Help:Blacklists]]).

* [b]Purged[/b] or [b]Expunged[/b] - Usually deleted posts are still on the server, so they can be undeleted if there was a mistake, or blocked from being reuploaded if not. Expunged posts are completely erased and gone for good, for example, post #6. This usually only happens in extreme circumstances—for example, illegal content.
** [tn][b]Note:[/b] The primary reason this is not usually done is that it makes it possible to reupload the exact same image, which would now be unbanned/undeleted.[/tn]

* [b]Flag[/b] or [b]Flagged[/b] - if a post is low quality or breaks the rules, you can flag it for deletion ([[Howto:Flag]])

* [b]Hard Translated[/b] - When a translation is applied directly onto the image ([[hard-translated]]). Danbooru's notes system allows translators to put translations in boxes floating over the image without changing the file itself; this is called a [b]soft translation[/b].

* [b]Normalized Source[/b] - When Danbooru uses the data provided from specific direct image links to give you normal sources that take you to the original post, eg. <https://i.pximg.net/img-original/img/2019/08/19/05/04/43/76340480_p0.png> brings to <https://www.pixiv.net/artworks/76340480>.
** [tn][b]Note:[/b] This is only possible for sites where the original post is embedded in the image link somewhere.[/tn]

* [b]Parent[/b] and [b]Child[/b] - A way to group together different versions of similar posts, or related posts ([[Help:Post relationships]])

h5. Tags

* [b]BUR[/b] - Stands for "Bulk Update Request." By filling out "this form":[/bulk_update_requests/new], you can request one or more aliases, implications, or mass updates between tags.
** [b]alias[/b] - When two tags mean the same thing, one can be set as an alias of the other, so that the aliased tag gets automatically changed to the destination tag on every post using it, and searching for the aliased tag searches for the destination instead ([[Help:Tag aliases]]).
** [b]implication[/b] - When the presence of one tag will always mean a second tag should be added to the image, the first can be set to imply the second ([[Help:Tag implications]]).
** [b]mass update[/b] - Changing one or more tags. For example, [[kancolle]] -> [[kantai collection]] would remove [[kancolle]] and replace it with [[kantai collection]] to all posts which contain the [[kancolle]] tag.
** [b]rename[/b] - Renames a tag, moving all of its wiki and history data to the new name.
** [b]category[/b] - Changes the category of a tag. Required on all tags with a post count greater than 1000, or those going to or from the [b]Meta[/b] category.

* [b]Pet Tag[/b] - A tag created and maintained by a single user, which usually has narrow or confusing guidelines (for example arbitrarily omitting certain kind of artworks) and has low value to other users in its present state.

* [b]Qualifier[/b] - A word in parentheses used as suffix for tags that have the same name, for example [[arrow_(projectile)]] and [[arrow_(symbol)]], or [[shimakaze (kancolle)|]] and [[shimakaze_(azur_lane)]]. Qualifiers are also used on artists that share name with other artists or tags, for example,  [[hammer]] and [[hammer_(sunset_beach)]]. See [[help:qualifiers]] for more information.

* [b]Tag Script[/b] - Not an actual script! A special mode that users with Gold level or higher can use to add/remove tags from posts just by clicking on their thumbnails ([[Help:Tag scripts]]).

* [b]Umbrella Tag[/b] - A generic tag that several specific tags imply. For example, [[rose]], [[daisy (flower)|]], and [[sunflower]] each imply [[flower]].

* [b]Utility Alias[/b] - An alias which doesn't move any post, made to improve searchability. For example, [[japanese sweets]] is aliased to [[wagashi]], because it's an uncommon word in English. This allows people to find the tag without having to google what Japanese sweets are called.

h5. Other

* [b]+1/-1[/b] - "I agree"/"I disagree"

* [b]DMail[/b] - Private message (Direct Mail).

* [b]DText[/b] - Text formatting system used for comments and forum posts ([[Help:DText]]).

* [b]Feedback[/b] or [b]User Feedback[/b] ([[Help:User records]])

h5. Danbooru site

* [b]API[/b] or [b]API Key[/b] or [b]API Limits[/b] - If you use external programs with Danbooru (for example mass downloaders or userscripts), the API is how they communicate with the site. The API Key lets your program do things that require an account; using the key tells the site that it's coming from you. The API Limit is how quickly the program is allowed to do things on the site. This limit exists to reduce the risk of massive site vandalism. See [[Help:API]] for more information.

* [b]Booru[/b] - Danbooru is the name of both this website and the site's behind-the-scenes software. There are other websites that use the same software, older/modified versions, or software with a similar idea. Altogether, these sites are called "boorus."

* [b]Safe mode[/b] - Danbooru's option to hide posts that are not rated general. Visit your account settings or use <https://donmai.moe>.

h5. Other sites

* [b]Rush Hour[/b] - Can refer to either the rush of artist uploads off-site or user uploads on-site, especially in the context of Pixiv for the former.
** [b]Pixiv Rush[/b] - Every day, Pixiv rankings reset at "00:00 JST":[https://www.google.com/search?q=00%3A00+jst&oq=00%3A00+jst]. Artists upload to Pixiv just after reset, so all views and favorites in the day count towards Pixiv's daily popular page. It's become enough of a tradition there that even artists who aren't popular or skilled enough to hit the popular page will still join the rush.
** [b]Danbooru Rush[/b] - Often times, as a Pixiv rush is happening, or after it has happened, a flood of uploaders on-site will rush to upload them as fast as possible; can also happen beyond Pixiv if a particularly popular artist uploads art elsewhere. Also see Sniping under User Actions.

* [b]stacc[/b] - A page on Pixiv that shows the uploads (and optionally the favorites) of a Pixiv user (e.g. <https://www.pixiv.net/stacc/hmizuki>). The stacc name is also the login name of the user. Sometimes the stacc name can be used as a qualifier for the artist's tag, but it should be avoided. See [[Howto:Pixiv]] for more information.

h4. See also

* topic #17178 - Thread where glossary terms are discussed.
* [[about:danbooru]]

title: hololive
body:
Hololive (stylized as "hololive") is an all-female [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] group managed by Hololive Production, which itself is owned and operated by Cover Corp.

As of September 2023, the hololive group consists of 4 major branches: the original Japanese-speaking branch (unofficially referred to as Hololive Japan), the other Japanese-speaking branch [[hololive DEV_IS]], [[hololive Indonesia]], and [[hololive English]]. (There was also the now-disbanded [[hololive China]].) Each branch is further divided into multiple generations, where each generation is a batch of VTubers who debuted at the same time. Hololive Production also manages the all-male counterpart group [[Holostars]].

In February 2021, Cover announced [[hololive Alternative]], a multimedia project including several manga and music videos that aims to tell in-universe stories using the hololive VTubers' character backstories. Later, in August 2021, Cover announced [[hololive Error]], a horror-themed spin-off project. A year later, in June 2022, Cover announced [[Holoearth]], a game featuring various hololive members. In March 2023, Cover announced [[Blue Journey (hololive)|]], a new musical project.

h4. List of Members

h5. hololive (original branch, [i]a.k.a.[/i] hololive Japan)

h6. hololive "[[0th Generation (hololive)|]]"

A term for the members not under a specific grouping. Some of these members debuted as independents and were initially brought into other now-defunct branches of the company before joining Hololive proper.

* [[Tokino Sora]] (debuted September 2017)
* [[Roboco-san]] (debuted March 2018)
* [[Hoshimachi Suisei]] (debuted as indie in March 2018, joined the company in May 2019, joined Hololive in December 2019)
* [[Sakura Miko]] (debuted August 2018, joined Hololive in December 2018)

title: kousaka_tamaki
body:
Character from the game [[To Heart 2]]. Frequently referred to as "Tama-nee". Has [[large breasts]], often has a [[:3]] expression, light [[brown eyes]] and long dark [[red hair]] usually worn in a [[two side up]] style resembling [[cat ears]].

She holds the honor of being the first character posted to [[Danbooru (site)|]] in post #1.

title: kujouin_nadeshiko
body:

She has [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]] and usually wears a [[white hairband]].

title: usami_sumireko
body:
[b]Expose the Esoteric! The Secret Sealing Club's First President[/b]

Final Boss of [i][[urban_legend_in_limbo| Urban Legend in Limbo]][/i], became a playable character in [i][[Antinomy of Common Flowers]][/i], and protagonist of [i][[Violet Detector]][/i]. She's a first-year high school student from the Outside World and is the founder of the Secret Sealing Club. She is a powerful [[psychic]] capable of [[telekinesis]], [[pyrokinesis]],  [[hydrokinesis]] and various other abilities. She's also a self-proclaimed [[chuunibyou]], and takes great pride in it.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] worn in [[low twintails]], and wears a [[high collar]] [[cloak]] with [[runes]] [[clothes_writing|inscribed on its interior]] and a [[Quimbaya airplane]] for a clasp. She also wears a [[plaid skirt]] and [[plaid vest]], which is made to look like her [[school uniform]]. She also sports red [[glasses]], and a black [[hat]] with a white [[bow|hat bow]].

Her connections to [[usami_renko|Usami Renko]] are currently unknown, but their identical surnames and both having hailed from the Kanto region indicate a familial tie.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2008664: her first appearance in [[Urban Legend In Limbo]] 
* !post #2130210: fan depiction of her later appearance in [[Curiosities Of Lotus Asia]] 

h4. See also

* "Touhou Wiki: Usami Sumireko":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Sumireko_Usami

title: challah
body: Challah is a special [[bread]] of [[Judaism|Ashkenazi Jewish]] origin, usually braided and typically eaten on ceremonial occasions such as Shabbat and major Jewish holidays. Ritually acceptable challah is made of dough from which a small portion has been set aside as an offering. Challah may also refer to the dough offering.

title: flying_spittle
body:
The saliva analogue of [[flying teardrops]] and [[flying sweatdrops]].

Use this tag when there are multiple discrete drops of saliva flying out of a character's mouth (or equivalent organ). This is likely to be depicted when a character is giving another one a stern scolding, or when gorging on food, or when getting punched in the face or stomach.

Avoid using this tag when [[spitting]], [[spit take]] or [[sneezing]] would be more appropriate. Though some examples may qualify for both.
Also avoid using this tag when the substance in question is not saliva (i.e. most [[spit take]] examples).

h4. See also
* [[Saliva]]
* [[Spitting]]
* [[Spit take]]
** Usually involves other liquids instead of saliva.
* [[Sneezing]]
** Usually depicted as a conical 'spray' instead of droplets.
* [[Saliva trail]]

title: sonia_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Sonia[/b] is a character introduced in [[pokemon swsh|Pokemon Sword and Shield]].

Sonia is a new professor researching the legends of Galar and has already published a book with her findings. She’s adventure buddies and childhood friends with [[Leon (pokemon)|]]. Her only known Pokemon is [[Yamper]].

She has [[aqua eyes]] and [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair|hair]] with [[heart hair ornament|hearts]] worn in a [[side ponytail|ponytail]]. She [[eyewear on head|wears]] [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[orange-tinted eyewear|tinted]] [[sunglasses]], a [[aqua shirt|aqua]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[ribbed shirt]] under a [[buttons|buttoned]] [[brown coat|coat]], a [[bracelet]], [[aqua nails|aqua]] [[nail polish|nail polish]], [[pants]], [[aqua boots|aqua]] [[high heel boots|heel boots]], and a [[handbag]].

title: umineko_no_naku_koro_ni
body:
Visual novel by 07th Expansion with an anime adaptation (aired 2009) and a version for the [[Playstation 3]] (released 2016).

Part of the When They Cry series, along with [[Higurashi no Naku Koro Ni]] and [[Ciconia no Naku Koro Ni]]. 07th Expansion also developed a fighting game for it called [[Ougon Musou Kyoku]].

h4. Arcs

* Episode 1: [[Legend of the Golden Witch]]
* Episode 2: [[Turn of the Golden Witch]]
* Episode 3: [[Banquet of the Golden Witch]]
* Episode 4: [[Alliance of the Golden Witch]]
* Episode 5: [[End of the Golden Witch]]
* Episode 6: [[Dawn of the Golden Witch]]
* Episode 7: [[Requiem of the Golden Witch]]
* Episode 8: [[Twilight of the Golden Witch]]

title: haruka_naru_enkei_sekai
body:
A sequel of [[Shironagasu-Tou E No Kikan]].
Visual novel created by [[Onimushi Hyogo]].

Still under development.

h4. Summary
 
[[Ikeda Sen]] a detective working in New York, is approached by a mysterious woman named Lila.
At the same time, his client Walton entrusts Ikeda with a mysterious device.
Meanwhile, [[Izumozaki Neneko]], who has returned to her everyday life, discovers a decomposing corpse along the Horikawa River on her way to school.
These two completely unrelated stories soon begin to strangely intersect...

h4.External Links

* Official page: https://tabinomichi.jp/
* Official trial version download : https://drive.google.com/drive/u/2/folders/1tKrB4gNE4alx8mD7KJFjswfRIlxSLeHS

title: yakumo_yukari
body:
The "Youkai of Boundaries". Phantasm Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]] and later a recurring playable character.

A powerful youkai of at least 1200 years of age, reputedly older than [[Gensokyo]] itself. Nominally responsible for guarding the border between Gensokyo and the outside world, but is frequently sleeping or slacking around, leaving her work to her shikigami [[Yakumo Ran]] and Ran's own shikigami [[Chen]].

Yukari has the power to manipulate boundaries, as well as create [[gap (touhou)|]]s, leading to her nickname "Sukima". However, she frequently holds back her powers and most of the time she only goes as far as playfully dragging any unsuspecting human from the outside world into Gensoukyou.

in [[Silent Sinner in Blue]] she has two pet crows - [[Zenki (touhou)|]] and [[Goki (touhou)|]].

Besides her servants, she is friends with [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] (whom she knew from as early as the latter's days as a human) and [[Hakurei Reimu]] (the other barrier guardian, whom she sometimes pesters). Also hinted to be [[Morichika Rinnosuke]]'s business partner and supplier of items from the outside world. Yukari has an as-yet undefined connection to [[Maribel Hearn]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8183476: Usual Appearance #1
* !post #3666559: Usual Appearance #2
* !post #2978699: [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]]

h4. Related Pools

* Pool #1970: God Damn It, Yukari! - Yukari being a troll, usually with her [[gap (touhou)|]] powers.
* Pool #4099: Good Work, Yukari! - Yukari using her powers for good
* Pool #22787: Yukari the mom - Yukari acting motherly to Reimu or another character in her own way

h4. See also

* [[Yakumo Yukari (young)]] for more girlish depictions of her (not necessarily loli)
* [[Sukima onna]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Yukari Yakumo":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Yukari_Yakumo

title: mythra_(massive_melee)_(xenoblade)
body:
The modified version of [[Mythra_(Xenoblade)|]] made for [[Super Smash Bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]] in order to keep the game at its E10 / CERO A rating. The name is a reference to [i]Melee[/i], the second entry in the series.

The [[cleavage]] [[cleavage cutout|cutout]] of her blouse is covered, and she now wears [[black pantyhose]]. 

It first appeared as a [[spirit_(super smash bros.)|spirit]] in the base game before appearing as an obtainable costume in [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]], later serving as her default appearance as a playable character.

title: iraq_war
body:
The [b]Iraq War[/b] refers to the [[war]] that began in "20 March 2003":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2003_invasion_of_Iraq when a coalition of countries, primarily led by the [[United States]] and the [[United Kingdom]], launched a military invasion of [[Iraq]]. The main stated reasons for this invasion were to eliminate Iraq's alleged weapons of mass destruction (WMDs), remove [[Saddam Hussein]] from power, and promote democracy and stability in the region.

The Iraq War had its roots in the aftermath of the [[9/11]] terrorist attacks in the United States in 2001. The U.S. government, under the administration of President [[George W. Bush]], argued that Iraq, under [[Saddam Hussein]], posed a threat due to its "WMD programs":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq_and_weapons_of_mass_destruction#2003_Iraq_War and its potential to support terrorist organizations. However, the invasion and subsequent "occupation of Iraq":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occupation_of_Iraq_(2003%E2%80%932011) faced significant "controversy":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_the_Iraq_War and "opposition":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rationale_for_the_Iraq_War, both domestically and internationally.

The conflict quickly led to the overthrow of Saddam Hussein's regime, with his "capture in 2003":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capture_of_Saddam_Hussein and "execution in 2006":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Execution_of_Saddam_Hussein, but the search for WMDs proved unsuccessful, and no substantial evidence of active WMD programs was found. The war also resulted in a "protracted insurgency":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraqi_insurgency_(2003%E2%80%932011), "sectarian violence":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sectarian_violence_in_Iraq#Sectarian_violence_following_the_U.S._invasion, and the rise of extremist groups, including "Al-Qaeda in Iraq":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Qaeda_in_Iraq (later known as the "Islamic State or ISIS":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State). After 8 years, 8 months and 25 days, the U.S. formally withdrew from Iraq on 15 December 2011, but has continued to maintain a small presence within the country, leading another "coalition":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Combined_Joint_Task_Force_%E2%80%93_Operation_Inherent_Resolve to combat the ongoing "ISIS insurgency":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State_insurgency_in_Iraq_(2017%E2%80%93present).

The Iraq War had a "profound and lasting impact on the region":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq_War#Impacts. It destabilized Iraq, causing "significant loss of life":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Iraq_War and "displacing millions of people":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humanitarian_crises_of_the_Iraq_War. The war also strained U.S. relations with some of its allies and led to widespread protests and opposition to the war. It remains a topic of debate and analysis with regard to its justifiability, consequences, and long-term effects on the Middle East and international politics.

h4. See also

* [[Gulf War]] - The conflict against Iraq in 1990 - 1991

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: 2003 invasion of Iraq":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2003_invasion_of_Iraq]
* "Wikipedia: Iraq War":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq_War]

title: load-bearing_piercing
body:
A piercing, often a [[nipple piercing]], which is structurally important to an outfit.  This can be due to the clothes being held on with a [[piercing through clothes]], or by the clothing hanging off of a [[ring piercing]] or similar.

Contrast [[piercing_pull]] when a piercing is being pulled on externally, but is not supporting something self-contained to the wearer.  Also contrast [[linked piercing]] or [[nipple jewelry]], [[nipple_bells]], etc. where the piercing is supporting a relatively small object or decorative accent, rather than some or all of a larger piece of clothing.

title: jinmensou
body:
Jinmensō is a term from Japanese folklore and traditional medicine, literally meaning “human-faced sore.”
It refers to a boil, cyst, or ulcer that is said to resemble a human face — often with features like eyes, nose, and mouth.

In legends, these sores were sometimes believed to have emotions, to speak, or even to laugh or cry, causing great distress to the afflicted person.

title: black_skin
body:
Skin colored [[black]], like coal or ebony. The opposite of [[white skin]].

For the usual brown, use [[dark skin]], [[very dark skin]] and/or [[tan]] as appropriate.

Unlike [[very dark skin]], black skin has no undertone, no hint of brown, yellow or red. Even the darkest of natural human skin has an undertone, even if not easily percieved at first glance or in some pictures. 

* !post #7639221: The character on the left has [[black skin]], while the character in the middle has [[dark skin]]

h4. See also

* [[dark skin]]
* [[white skin]]
* [[Tag group:Skin color]]

title: hollow_knight
body:
A 2D metroidvania action-adventure game published by indie Australian developer Team Cherry and first released in February 2017.

The player takes control of a nameless insectoid [[Knight (Hollow Knight)|]] who stumbles upon a fallen underground kingdom inhabited by bug-like creatures, many of which are made hostile due to a supernatural infection.

A sequel with recurring boss [[Hornet (Hollow Knight)|]] as the main character, [[Hollow Knight: Silksong]], was announced in February 2019 and released in September 2025.

title: gm_(mobile_suit)
body:
A [[mobile suit]] that first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] (1979). 

The [b]GM[/b] ([b]Gundam Mass Production[/b]), also referred simply as the [b]Jim[/b], is an [[Earth Federation]] mass production all-environment, generic, multi-role combat [[mobile suit]] based off the design and data obtained from the learning computer of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] more advanced prototype.

It is far less powerful and durable than the original Gundam due to heavily simplified and low-grade parts, but much cheaper to mass produce and easier to maintain, modify and repair. Due to its generally average to low performance (even being often depicted as a "cannon fodder" of some sort within the series), it spawned several variants, each with an attempt to make the mobile suit on-par with the more modern Gundams and whatever they were pitted against.

In real life, it was designed by [[Ookawara Kunio]] in the late 1970s, and was inspired by the [[M4 Sherman]] and [[T-34]] [[tank]]s of [[World War II]]. The mecha was also called the [b]Jimmy[/b] in the [[Genshiken]] anime comedy series.

h4. Variations of the GM

title: shuji_ito
body:
Male character from [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]].

He is the mysterious -and always starving- most recent newtype pilot of the legendary [[Red Gundam]] [[mobile suit]] (to which he has some kind of Newtype bond). 

[spoilers]Disappeared with the Red Gundam during a mini-[[Zeknova]] event. His pet robot Conch was adopted by [[Nyaan (gundam gquuuuuux)|]] afterwards..[/spoilers]
 
[spoilers]Reappears in the final episodes of the series, where Ito himself reveals to a terrified [[amate yuzuriha|Machu]] that he is actually from an [[alternate universe]] and thus seeks the destruction of the GQuuuuuux universe by using the [[Elmeth|Rose of Sharon]] and the original [[RX-78-2 Gundam]].[/spoilers]

His character design is similar to a younger [[Kamille Bidan]] from [[Zeta Gundam]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24142167

h4. See also

* [[Conch (gundam)|]]

title: kouretsuken_mahiru
body:
Character from [[Shinrabanshou]]'s 2010 storyline, Zex Factor. Full name Hinata Mahiru (日夏真昼). A 17-year old fox-type beastman who attends Houou Academy, where she acts as the student council's accountant. Wields the sword "Gouretsuken Kangiten", from which her title is derived, and has the power to strengthen her own muscles and manipulate earth pulses.

h4. Card:

* "Gouretsuken Mahiru":http://www.palusuke.com/list/zexfacter2/ZX033.html

title: shinrabanshou
body:
A collectable card game released by Bandai that comes packaged with candy and chocolate wafers. Introduces a different storyline featuring new characters every year. Its official mascot is [[Waferman]], while the most well-known character is [[astaroth (shinrabanshou)|Astaroth]]. Ended in 2019, and was followed by its successor [[Choujuu Giga Gao Road]] in 2021.

title: froslass
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0478 in the National Pokédex, an Ice/Ghost-type.

A vaguely humanoid Pokémon with a hollow torso that resembles a [[kimono]]. Has light [[blue eyes]], [[yellow sclera]]e, and a [[red sash|red]], [[obi]]-like [[sash]] around its waist. Usually seen [[floating]].

Evolves from female [[Snorunt]].

Japanese name: [b]Yukimenoko[/b]

h4. Official art
* !post #6458039

h4. Related Pokémon
* [[Glalie]]

h4. External links
*"Bulbapedia":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Froslass_(Pokémon)

Prior Pokémon: [[Dusknoir]]
Next Pokémon: [[Rotom]]

title: reckless_pallad_(genshin_impact)
body:
A quest-exclusive NPC from [[Genshin Impact]] who appears in several quests. He is a member of the Adventurers' Guild in Mondstadt.

He appears in the Random World Quest [i]Pallad's Dilemma[/i] at random locations throughout Mondstadt, where he is found surrounded by angry [[Hilichurl (genshin impact)|]]s or [[slime (genshin impact)|]]s and in need of rescue.

Pallad has [[medium hair|medium]] [[brown hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears the standard Adventurers' Guild uniform, consisting of a [[white shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] overtop a [[green shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[green vest|green]] [[cross-laced vest]], [[green capelet]], [[red necktie]], a [[brown belt]], [[green pants]], a [[green hat|green]] [[dixie cup hat]] and a pair of [[brown boots]]. 

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Reckless Pallad":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Reckless_Pallad

title: hoopa
body:
A Mythical [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #0720 in the National Pokédex.

Carries [[gold ring]]s that function as [[portal (object)|portals]]. The "Prison Bottle":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Prison_Bottle item allows it to change from its [[hoopa (confined)|Confined]] form into its much larger [[hoopa (unbound)|Unbound]] form.

Japanese name: [b]Hoopa[/b]

h4. Official art

title: griseous_orb
body:
An item from the [[pokemon|Pokémon]] games. If held by the Legendary [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] [[Giratina]], it will boost the power of its Ghost- and Dragon-type moves.

Prior to [[pokemon legends: arceus|Pokémon Legends: Arceus]], it allowed Giratina to change into its [[giratina (origin)|Origin Forme]]. This effect is now granted by different item, the [i]Griseous Core[/i].

title: mega_ring
body:
A [[bracelet]]-like accessory from [[pokemon|Pokémon]] that enables [[Mega Evolution]]. This tag applies to standard Mega Rings, such as those worn by [[Calem (pokemon)|]] and [[Serena (pokemon)|]], as well as the Mega Bracelets worn by [[Brendan (pokemon)|]] and [[May (pokemon)|]] in [[pokemon_oras|Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire]].

title: halftone
body:
A technique in which different tones of color [b]or[/b] shades of grey are simulated using a pattern of dots that vary in size, shape or spacing. These can appear either by artistic choice, or as a consequence of reproduction.

If the dots are all equal in size, use [[Ben-Day dots]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #1500677: [[Ben-Day dots]] over the hair and faces vs [[Halftone]] over the background
* !post #1055526

h4. See also

* [[screentones]]
** [[Ben-Day dots]]
* [[dithering]]
* [[halftone background]]
* [[halftone outline]]
* [[polka dot]]
* [[hatching (texture)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Halftone":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halftone]

This tag should only be used when it is clear by either the creation date, content, or commentary that the post was made specifically in honor of their graduation.

title: chrom_(fire_emblem)
body:
Main protagonist of [[Fire Emblem]] [[Fire Emblem Awakening|Awakening]]. The prince of the Halidom of Ylisse and a descendent of [[marth (fire emblem)|Marth]] himself, Chrom is the leader of a militia force known as the Shepherds. He is the middle sibling of three: [[Emmeryn (Fire Emblem)|Emmeryn]], his elder sister, is the Exalt of Ylisse, and [[Lissa (Fire Emblem)|Lissa]] is his younger sister.

[spoiler][[Lucina (Fire Emblem)|Lucina]] is revealed to be his own daughter from the future.[/spoiler]

CV: [[Sugita Tomokazu]] (JP), [[Matthew Mercer]] (EN)

title: quinn_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], he runs a fruit stall by the front gates in Mondstadt. 

He can be found talking to his childhood friend [[Beatrice (genshin impact)|]] and is oblivious to the fact she is infatuated with him. He is also one of the Four Drunkards, drinkers on par with Grand Master [[Varka (genshin impact)|]] and is nicknamed "Sir Dullwits the Oblivious Merchant".

Quinn has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears a [[brown shirt|brown]] [[cross-laced top|cross-laced shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], a [[brown belt]], [[brown pants]] and a pair of [[brown boots|brown]] [[lace-up boots]]. He has [[bandages]] on both of his [[bandaged arm|arms]] and a [[basket]] on his [[backpack basket|back]].

h4. Four Drunkards
[table]
[tbody]
[tr][td][[Draff (genshin impact)|]][/td][td][i]Oddears the Incredible Hunter[/i][/td][/tr]

[tr][td][b]Quinn[/b][/td][td][b][i]Sir Dullwits the Oblivious Merchant[/b][/i][/td][/tr]

title: cyrus_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin impact]], he is the Branch Master of the Adventurers' Guild in Mondstadt. He is the younger brother of [[Iris (genshin impact)|]], another member of the Adventurers' Guild and the father of [[Marjorie (genshin impact)|]].

Cyrus has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[beard]] and a [[mustache]], [[green eyes]] and a [[monocle]]. He wears the standard Adventurers' Guild uniform, consisting of a [[white shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[brown vest|brown]] [[cross-laced vest]], a [[green capelet]], [[brown gloves]], two [[crossed belts|crossed]] [[brown belt]]s with [[belt pouch|pouches]], [[green pants]] and a pair of [[white boots]].

Voiced by [b]Tashiro Tetsuya[/b] in Japanese and [[Sean Chiplock]] in English (same as [[Diluc (genshin impact)|]]).

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Cyrus":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Cyrus_(Mondstadt)

title: jack_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], he is a member of the Adventurers' Guild in Mondstadt.

Jack is a novice adventurer and former member of [[Bennett (genshin impact)|Benny]]'s Adventure Team before leaving due to Bennett's bad luck. He greatly idolizes [[Cyrus (genshin impact)|]] and [[Stanley (genshin impact)|]]. He is also one of the Four Drunkards, drinkers on par with Grand Master [[Varka (genshin impact)|]] and is nicknamed "Rookie McSchoolboy the Inexperienced Adventurer".

Jack has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears the standard Adventurers' Guild uniform, consisting of a [[white shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] overtop a [[green shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[green vest|green]] [[cross-laced vest]], [[green capelet]], [[red necktie]], a [[brown belt]], [[green pants]], a [[green hat|green]] [[dixie cup hat]] and a pair of [[brown boots]].  He has [[brown bag|brown]] [[backpack]] on his back filled with [[spring onion|leek]]s and [[onion]]s.

h4. Four Drunkards

[tbody]

title: vengeance_(armored_core)
body:
An Armored Core in [[Armored Core V]], which serves as the promotional [[mecha]] of the game.

It is the retrofitted version of [[Vendetta (Armored Core)|]] comprised entirely of UCR-10/A parts. It is most notable of using [[Grind Blade (armored core)|]].

title: olaf_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], he is a hunter for the village of Springvale. He is a distant ancestor of [[Draff (genshin impact)|]] and [[Diona (genshin impact)|]].

Olaf had been [[frozen]] for the past 300 years by a [[Cryo Regisvine (genshin impact)|]] after chasing a [[boar]] into some ruins. After being recently unfrozen, the Traveler and [[Xiangling (genshin impact)|]] run into him while looking for fresh ingredients and warm him up. He returns to Springvale where he must get used to life in the future.

Olaf has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with a [[beard]] and [[blue eyes]]. Being a part of the Kätzlein Bloodline, he also has a pair of [[cat ears]]. He wears a [[green shirt]] with [[short sleeves|short]] [[cross-laced sleeves]], a [[white vest]], a [[brown belt]] with a [[belt pouch|pouch]], [[green pants]] and a pair of [[green boots|green]] [[lace-up boots]]. He has [[bandages]] on both of his [[bandaged arm|arms]] and carries a [[quiver]] on his back filled with [[arrow (projectile)|]]s.

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Olaf":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Olaf

title: draff_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], he is the head hunter for the village of Springvale. He is the father of [[Diona (genshin impact)|]] and a distant descendant of [[Olaf (genshin impact)|]]. 

Despite being a capable leader and hunter, Draff is an alcoholic and is one of the Four Drunkards, drinkers on par with Grand Master [[Varka (genshin impact)|]] and is nicknamed "Oddears the Incredible Hunter". He can be very egocentric and lacks inhibition when drunk and is the reason Diona depises alcohol so much.

Draff has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with a [[beard]], a [[mustache]] and [[blue eyes]]. Being a part of the Kätzlein Bloodline, he also has a pair of [[cat ears]]. He wears a [[brown shirt]] with [[short sleeves|short]] [[cross-laced sleeves]], a [[brown vest]], a [[brown belt]] with a [[belt pouch|pouch]], [[brown pants]] and a pair of [[brown boots|brown]] [[lace-up boots]]. He has [[bandages]] on both of his [[bandaged arm|arms]] and carries a [[quiver]] on his back filled with [[arrow (projectile)|]]s.

Voiced by [b]Cory Yee[/b] in English (same as [[Gorou (genshin impact)|]]).

h4. Four Drunkards

title: inubashiri_momiji
body:
The "White Wolf Tengu". Stage 4 midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [i]Mountain of Faith[/i].

A [[wolf girl|wolf]] tengu with the ability to see great distances who patrols Youkai Mountain. For lack of official art, she is commonly depicted with [[wolf ears]] and [[wolf tail|tail]], even if inconsistently shown in official side manga. She is known for her cooperative and dutiful personality, so early fanworks often portrayed her as loyal and puppy-like to [[Shameimaru Aya]], but it was later revealed that she dislikes Aya and will not take orders from her since they belong to different chains of command.

Genderswapped/trap (otoko no ko) Momiji is very popular, and is tagged as ショタ椛 on Pixiv.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair]] with [[medium bangs|medium-length bangs]] and usually has [[animal ear fluff|fluff in her ears]] and [[red eyes|red]] or [[brown eyes]]. She wears a small [[red hat|red]] [[tokin hat]] with dangling [[pom pom (clothes)|]]s, a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[turtleneck shirt|turtleneck]] [[white shirt]], [[ribbon-trimmed sleeves|ribbon-trimmed]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]], a [[two-tone skirt|two-tone]] [[black skirt|black]] and [[red skirt]] with a [[maple leaf print|maple leaf]] [[print skirt|print]], and [[tengu-geta]]. She usually carries a [[holding sword|sword]] and a [[holding shield|shield]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6513215: Profile

h4. See also 

* [[Inubashiri Momiji (Wolf)]] 
* [[Mofuji]] 

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Momiji Inubashiri":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Momiji_Inubashiri

[[Armored Core: Last Raven]] has an AI-controled AC called Quartz Clock, which is a recreation of Wonder Raid using parts of 3rd generation games.

body:
The promotional AC from the original [[Armored Core]] and it sequel/expansion [[Armored Core: Master of Arena]], also known as [b]Phoenix[/b] in English version of MoA.

[[Armored Core: Last Raven]] has an AI-controled AC called Jetter (ジェッダー), which is a recreation of Anfang/Phoenix using parts of 3rd generation games.

title: arnold_(genshin_impact)
body:
An event-exclusive NPC from [[Genshin Impact]] who appeared in the version 2.8 event [i]Summertime Odyssey[/i]. Also known as "Ask-Me-For-Directions Arnold", he is a night raven in the Immernachtreich who became smitten with [[Mona (genshin impact)|]] at first sight.

He is depicted as a night raven statue with a [[purple scarf]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

title: blanche_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she is a shopkeeper at Mondstadt General Goods in Mondstadt.

Blanche has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a [[brown shirt|brown]] and [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[cross-laced top]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[brown sleeves|brown]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[black belt]], [[puffy shorts|puffy]] [[brown shorts|brown]] [[short shorts]] and a pair of [[brown boots]] She has [[bandages]] on her [[bandaged leg|right leg]].

Voiced by Christie Cate in English (same as [[Qiqi (genshin impact)|]]).

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Blanche":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Blanche_(Mondstadt)

title: brook_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she is a chef from Springvale who sells cooked food. 

Brook loves [[meat]] and her meat-based dishes are very popular throughout Mondstadt. She faces fellow chef [[Xiangling (genshin impact)|]] in a cooking showdown in Xiangling's story quest, [i]Mondstadt Gastronomy Trip[/i].

Brook has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] tied into [[low twintails]], [[parted bangs]] and [[yellow eyes]]. She wears a [[brown pantyhose]] and a [[dirndl]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[shirt]], a [[brown corset]] and a [[long skirt|long]] [[orange skirt]]. She has an [[orange choker]], an orange [[bracelet]] on each arm and a pair of [[orange shoes|orange]] [[high heels]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Brook":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Brook

title: crest_cru-c75u2_close_combat_ac
body:
An unnamed AC [[mecha]] from the Japanese box art of [[Armored Core 3]].

Same AC appears in [[Armored Core: Last Raven]], named Dirty Slime.

title: noblesse_oblige_(armored_core)
body:
An Armored Core NEXT [[mecha]] in [[Armored Core 4]] and [[Armored Core: For Answer]] and the original mascot AC at 4's original announcement, before it was changed to [[Supplice]] for the actual launch.

It is piloted by Leonhardt in 4 and Gerald Gendlin, Leonhardt's successor in For Answer.

It is a TYPE-HOGIRE painted in white and black, equipped with kinetic [[assault rifle]], energy blade and two sets of EC-O307AB triple energy [[shoulder cannon]], spread like [[mechanical wings]].

The difference between Leonhardt's and Gerald's versions are the model of guns held in its right hand.
other_names: ノブリス・オブリージュ

body:
An outfit that can be obtained from one of the permanent banners in [[Miracle Nikki]]. It is, as the name implies, [[rose]]-themed, and associated with [[nikki (nikki)|Nikki]].

title: margaret_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she is the owner of The Cat's Tail tavern in Mondstadt and can be found wandering around the fountain plaza.

Her tavern The Cat's Tail has recently seen a business boom after she hired [[Diona (genshin impact)|]], whom she hired her simply because she is cute, despite clearly not being old enough to drink alcohol. Margaret is also one of the Four Drunkards, drinkers on par with Grand Master [[Varka (genshin impact)|]] and is nicknamed "Dame Workshy the Absentee Boss". She also has two known cats, [[Prince (genshin impact)|]] and [b]Butterfly[/b].

Margaret has [[medium hair|medium]]/[[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a [[black pantyhose]] and a [[dirndl]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[shirt]], a [[red corset]] and a [[long skirt|long]] [[red skirt]]. She has a [[brown hat]], a red [[bracelet]] on each arm, a [[red choker]] and a pair of [[red shoes|red]] [[high heels]].

h4. Four Drunkards

title: aubrey_(omori)
body:
A character from [[OMORI]]. 

[[AUBREY (FARAWAY) (omori)|]] has [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with a [[aqua_hairband|aqua]] [[hairband]]. She has [[aqua eyes]] and wears a [[white jacket]] with a [[yellow sailor collar|yellow]] or [[black sailor collar|black]] [[sailor collar]] over a black [[crop top]]. She wears [[denim shorts]] or [[denim skirt|skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[socks]] and [[sneakers]]. She often carries a [[nail bat]]. Naturally, she has dark [[brown hair|brown]] or [[black hair]] and has [[black eyes]].

For her preteen FARAWAY appearance, use this tag and [[aged down]].

[[AUBREY (HEADSPACE) (omori)|]] has [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with a [[pink_bow|pink]] [[hair bow]]. She wears a [[short_sleeves|short sleeved]] [[aqua dress]] and is often seen carrying her [[stuffed toy]] named [[MR. PLANTEGG (omori)|]].

She is represented by the [[gladiolus]].
