title: reverse_spirit
body:
The form that Spirits undergo in [[Date a Live]] when they are put through significant mental stress and negative emotions. Visually, their [[astral dress]] changes as well to make an "[[dark persona]]". They also act much more differently, specifically become more violent and their destructive power increases.

[spoiler]They are actually the natural form of sephira crystals, but [[Takamiya Mio|the Spirit of Origin]] changed them through lots of trial and error to make them compatible with a human vessel.[/spoiler]

List of all of the inverse/reverse spirits:

* [[Honjou Nia (Inverse)]] 
* [[Tobiichi Origami (Inverse)]] 
* [[Yatogami Tenka]]

title: frederica_gunnhildr
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]]. Also known as the "Alder Knight", she is a member of the Gunnhildr Clan and a commander in the Knights of Favonius. She is the mother of [[Jean (genshin impact)|]] and [[Barbara (genshin impact)|]] and the former wife of [[Seamus Pegg]].

Frederica fell in love with Seamus, a former famed adventurer turned Seneschal of Mondstadt's Church of Favonius and they would later marry and have two kids, Jean and Barbara. At some point, a rift formed in their marriage and they separated; Frederica left with Jean and Barbara stayed with Seamus. 

She has yet to make a physical appearance in-game, as she was accompanying Grand Master [[Varka (genshin impact)|]] on his expedition with most of the Knights of Favonius, serving as Varka's second-in-command. Frederica was recently ordered to return to Mondstadt with a group of the knights while Varka headed to Nod-Krai, where she is currently aiding in the defense of Dornman Port.

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Frederica Gunnhildr":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Frederica_Gunnhildr

body:
A ready-to-eat, no-cook food composed of instant [[noodles]], typically [[instant ramen|ramen]] noodles, complete with flavoring, contained in insulated foam or plastic containers, which are typically cup- or bowl-shaped. Just add hot water and wait three minutes before eating, though some brands instruct to just add water and place into a microwave for three minutes before eating.

For [[Nissin]]'s cup ramen brand, use "[[nissin cup noodle]]" instead.

title: sunflower
body:
A native flowering plant from the Americas.  The common sunflower is most recognizable by their single large [[yellow flower|yellow]] apical "flower," with an initially greenish center that turns yellow-brown and then blackish as it matures.  They typically grow to heights of around 3 meters (10 feet) with record plants reach heights of 9+ meters (30+ feet). Sunflowers are grown for various purposes such as for food, cooking oil, livestock feed, and decoration. 

Domestic sunflowers come in a variety of colors beyond the common yellow, with colors such as cream color, gold, orange, red, mahogany, and chocolate brown.  While the common types only feature a singular apical flower (one that grows at the tip of the central stem), there are also varieties that grow many additional branching flowers.  The large blooms of the sunflower while commonly called a "flower" is in fact a "flower head," a structure composed of many smaller flowers (florets) that together appear as one single flower.

Sunflowers and their relatives are heliotropic while they're developing, meaning that the plants will turn following the direction of the sun during the day.  As they get closer to maturing, the plant stiffen and lose it's ability to track the sun. Due to their heliotropic nature, most plants will mature locked facing toward the East, the direction of the rising sun.

h4. Examples

* !post #6797029

h4. See also

* [[Sunflower seed]]
* [[Tag group:flowers]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Common Sunflower":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_sunflower]

title: seamus_pegg
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]]. Also known as the "Cardinal of Daybreak", he is one of the leaders of Mondstadt and the Seneschal of the Church of Favonius. He is the father of [[Jean (genshin impact)|]] and [[Barbara (genshin impact)|]] and the former husband of [[Frederica Gunnhildr]]. 

Seamus was once an adventurer famed throughout Teyvat before settling in Mondstadt and starting anew with the Church of Favonius, where he would later rise to the position of Seneschal. He fell in love with Frederica of the Gunnhildr Clan and they would later marry and have two kids, Jean and Barbara. At some point, a rift formed in their marriage and they separated; Frederica would leave with Jean and Barbara stayed with Seamus.

He has yet to make a physical appearance in-game, as he is currently accompanying Grand Master [[Varka (genshin impact)|]] on his expedition, with his responsibilities currently entrusted to [[Cardinal Calvin (genshin impact)|]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Seamus Pegg":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Seamus_Pegg

title: amos_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]], she was an inhabitant of Old Mondstadt around 2600 years before the events of the game.

Amos was a huntress and the lover of [[Decarabian (genshin impact)|]], the ruler of Old Mondstadt, until she became disillusioned with him. At some point, she befriended the [[Nameless Bard (genshin impact)|]], a [[Barbatos (genshin impact)|wind spirit]], a knight (possibly [[Gunnhildr (genshin impact)|]]) and a [[red-haired warrior (genshin impact)|]] (possibly an ancestor to [[Diluc (genshin impact)|]]). Together they lead the rebellion against Decarabian and though victorious, she was ultimately slain in battle. 

She was the wielder and namesake of [[Amos' Bow (genshin impact)|]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

title: leonardo_da_vinci_(fate)
body:
A Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Appears as part of [[Chaldea Security Organization]]'s staff, being their 3rd successful heroic spirit summon. While male in life, da Vinci chose to embody the appearance of the [[Mona Lisa]] painting that he worked on during his life, as genius has no gender.

After the events of the Part 2 Prologue [spoiler]wherein she is murdered by [[Grigori Rasputin (fate)|]][/spoiler], a younger [[Leonardo da Vinci (Rider) (fate)|Rider-class version]] of her appears instead.

body:
Rider-class version of [[leonardo da vinci (fate)|Leonardo Da Vinci]], first seen in the [[Fate/Grand Order]] Part 2 prologue but first implemented as a Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]]. She uses [[roller skates]], and appears [[aged down|younger]] than her usual self.

title: takasugi_shinsaku_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character first appearing in the [[GUDAGUDA Ryouma Kiki Ippatsu!]] event. A central figure in the early [[Meiji]] Restoration during the 1860s, who put all his efforts into opening the way to modernization, westernization and reforms, not only in military matters but in political and social matters as well. He died of tuberculosis at only 28 years old.

He was introduced as a playable Archer-class servant in in the [[Chaldea Juukou Monogatari]] event. Usually seen carrying a [[shamisen]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Endo (takolegs)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Kakihara Tetsuya]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #9083081

title: cacucu_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC in [[Genshin Impact]].

A unique [[qucusaurus_(genshin_impact)|Qucusaurus]], and the Saurian partner of [[ifa_(genshin_impact)|Ifa]]. Cacucu has the unique ability to learn and repeat phrases of human speech.

Cacucu's body is differently shaped than normal Qucusaurs, being small and very round in shape. He has two very small wings, an eyepatch with a circled X drawn on it taped over one eye, one bandaged leg, and typically carries a small pack on his back.

title: golden_delmo
body:
In [[Agent Aika]], they are yellow-uniformed members of the Delmogeny who serve as a special elite force, and are the main antagonists after Hagen's death. The Golden [[delmogeny_uniform|Delmo uniform]] consists of:
** A [[yellow dress]] with [[juliet sleeves]] and a [[cleavage cutout]]. The dress also has streaks of which color varies by member.
** [[White socks|White]] [[bobby_socks|bobby]] [[socks]].
** [[Yellow footwear|Yellow]] [[high heels]].

title: aika_(series)
body:
[b]AIKa[/b] is an anime franchise created by Studio Fantasia. The series was well known for large amounts of fanservice, specifically "creative" camera angles that focused on the panties of the many female characters. All OVA's were Directed by Katsuhiko Nishijima, and [[Yamauchi Noriyasu]] oversaw Animation Direction and the Character Designs.

title: tonia_(agent_aika)
body:
[b]Tonia[/b] (トニア) is a character in [[Agent AIKa]].

Tonia is a woman with [[long_hair|long]] [[silver hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She styles her hair into a [[braid]] with a [[blue_ribbon|blue]] [[hair_ribbon|ribbon]]. Her [[golden_delmo|Golden]] [[delmogeny_uniform|Delmo uniform]] consists of a [[yellow dress]] with [[juliet sleeves]] and a [[cleavage cutout]], [[white socks|white]] [[bobby_socks|bobby]] [[socks]], [[yellow_footwear|yellow]] [[high heels]], and [[white panties]].

title: list_of_genshin_impact_tags
body:
A list of currently in use tags related to [[Genshin Impact]].
For characters, see [[list of genshin impact characters]].

h4. Items

h6. Items seen on characters

* [[Vision (genshin impact)|]] - Gem that matches one's element and is used to summon elemental power
* [[Gnosis (genshin impact)|]] - An item held by an Archon [tn]A god of a specific element and region[/tn] that acts as their vision
* [[Delusion (genshin impact)|]] - Artificial vision made by the Fatui

h6. Currency

* [[Primogem]] - The standard gacha currency. 160 of these can be exchanged for one Fate
* [[Intertwined Fate]] - A star-like item that can be used for pulling in the limited gacha once, has a pink-blue gradient
* [[Acquaint Fate]] - Can only be used in the permanent banner, colored in blue
* [[Stella Fortuna]] - The item recieved once you pull a duplicate character, can be used to enhance said character
* [[Masterless Stella Fortuna (genshin impact)|]] 
* [[Masterless Starglitter]] 
* [[Genesis Crystal]] - Premium currency only obtained through in-game purchases 

h6. Inventory items

* [[Artifact (genshin impact)|]] - Character equipment. Can have a variety of appearances depending on its type.
* [[Cloud Retainer Damasked Device (genshin impact)|]] - A paper bird companion given as a gift to the player from the [[Cloud Retainer (genshin impact)|]].
* [[Crimson Agate (genshin impact)|]] - A red crystal found in Dragonspine. Used at the Frostbearing Tree.
* [[Crown of Insight]] - A crown with a triquetra shape. Used to level up a character's talents to their final stage.
* [[Handguard (genshin impact)|]] - A handguard dropped by [[Nobushi (genshin impact)|]] and [[Kairagi (genshin impact)|]].
* [[Itty Bitty Octobaby (genshin impact)|]] - A tiny octopus companion.
* [[Mora (genshin impact)|]] - Genshin's equivalent to "gold" or "coins". Has a triquetra shape printed on it.
* [[Oculus (genshin impact)|]] - Found in the open world. Used at Statues of the Seven.
* [[Serenitea Pot (genshin impact)|]] - A teapot gadget which grants access to the housing mechanic.
* [[Shiki Koshou]] - A shikigami companion given as a gift to the player from [[Shiki Taishou]].
* [[Waverider (genshin impact)|]] - A boat.
* [[Wind Glider]] - Artificial wings used to glide.

title: cu_chulainn_(casual_wear)_(fate)
body:
[[Cu Chulainn (Lancer) (fate)|]]'s casual wear from [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]]. He wears a white v-necked shirt with black leather pants. In [[Emiya-san Chi no Kyou no Gohan]], he is also seen wearing a jacket. He wears different aprons on top of this costume when working his various part-time jobs around Fuyuki.

h4. Appearance
* !post #13700: [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]] (left)
* !asset #25957908: [[Emiya-san Chi no Kyou no Gohan]]
* !asset #26216336: [[cu chulainn (fish shop apron) (fate)|Fish Shop Apron]] (center)
* !asset #26216315: Left: [[cu chulainn (flower shop apron) (fate)|Flower Shop Apron]][br]Center: [[cu chulainn (fancy apron) (fate)|Fancy Apron]]

h4. See also
* [[Cu Chulainn (Aloha Shirt) (fate)|]]

title: shiroe_(bombergirl)
body: Shiroe (シロヱ) is an unlockable playable character in [i][[Bombergirl]][/i]. She is the widowed mother of [[shiro_(bombergirl)|Shiro]] and [[shiron_(bombergirl)|Shiron]]. Inspired by bomberking.

title: ghislaine_dedoldia
body:
Ghislaine Dedoldia (ギレーヌ・デドルディア) from [[Mushoku Tensei]] is a former member of the party Fangs of the Black Wolf, a group that once included [[Paul Greyrat]] and [[Elinalise Dragonroad]]. She previously served as a bodyguard for the Boreas family and holds a King rank in the Sword God Style, having trained under the Sword God, [[Gal Farion]].

In addition to being a bodyguard, she was also a swordsmanship instructor for [[Eris Greyrat]] and [[Rudeus Greyrat]], who in turn taught her general education and magic. After the Mana Disaster, she reunited with Eris, and the two travel together to the Holy Land of Swords for training.
* !asset #31949365
* !asset #31949368
* !asset #31949370


h4. External links

* "Mushoku Tensei Wiki: Ghislaine Dedoldia":[https://mushokutensei.fandom.com/wiki/Ghislaine_Dedoldia]
other_names: ギレーヌ・デドルディア

title: violet_evergarden
body:
"Leidenschaftlich's Battle Maiden" and the titular protagonist of [[Violet Evergarden (series)|]].

An orphaned former child soldier who became an Auto Memories Doll (a person who works to assist others by writing for them) under the CH Postal Company. Considered a beautiful woman but lacks [[expressionless|expressions]], emotions, and remorse; but eventually meets different people and learns to become "human". Has [[prosthetic_arm|prosthetic]] [[mechanical arms]] after losing her arms in the war. 

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[blonde hair]] with [[bangs]] and [[hair between eyes]], as well as [[blue eyes]]. Usually depicted with a [[braid]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]], [[white dress]], [[blue jacket]], a [[necklace]] with a [[brooch]] in the middle, and a [[white skirt]].
other_names: ヴァイオレット・エヴァーガーデン
ヴァイオレットエヴァーガーデン

title: tsukuo_(gintama)
body:
The canonical genderswap of [[Tsukuyo (gintama)|]]. He looks like an [[blonde hair]]ed middle aged man with scar on left side of face and forehead. In first appear he wear [[red shirt]], open dark-[[blue kimono]] with orange leaves print on shoulders and wide [[black pants]].

It can sometimes appear as “Tsukiyu” in searches, but that’s just because some people who don’t know how to read “月雄” convert it directly into romaji.

title: evolution_championship_series
body:
An [[eSports]] [[Fighting game]] tournament held annually in [[Las Vegas]], Nevada, [[United States]]. Generally considered the [i]de facto[/i] world championship for most fighting games, due to its large turnout.

h4. Notable events that have inspired fanart
* 2004: [[Evo Moment #37]], where during a [i][[Street Fighter III (series)|Street Fighter III]]: 3rd Strike[/i] match between [[Umehara Daigo]] and [[Justin Wong (gamer)|Justin Wong]], Umehara fully parries a [[Chun-Li]] super performed by Wong with little life left on his [[Ken Masters|Ken]], to turn the tables on Wong and win the round. The video of this moment and the wild crowd reaction to it became a viral hit on the Internet and inspires many tributes.
* 2013: The Evo organizers announce 7 games for the event, and announce an 8th game will be decided by a donation drive for cancer research, with the game whose community donates the most money getting the spot at the tournament. The two games raising the most money during the drive are [i][[Skullgirls]][/i] and [i][[Super Smash Bros.]] Melee[/i], with [i]Melee[/i] ultimately winning out and getting the spot in the tournament. 
* 2014: French player Luffy wins the [i][[street_fighter_iv_(series)|Ultra Street Fighter IV]][/i] tournament with [[Rose (Street Fighter)|Rose]], being the first non-Asian player to win an Evo [i]SFIV[/i] tournament. 
* 2015: During a [i][[Guilty Gear Xrd]][/i] match between Woshige and Ogawa, Woshige celebrates too early after winning a round and his unattended [[Millia Rage]] is swiftly beaten by Ogawa's [[Zato-1]] in the decisive round of the match.
* 2018: The first Evo event outside the United States is held in Tokyo, Japan as "Evo Japan 2018":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evo_Japan_2018.
* 2024: In a moment during a [i][[Street Fighter III (series)|Street Fighter III]]: 3rd Strike[/i] Losers Quarterfinals match popularly dubbed "[[EVO Moment #41]]", [[Hugo Andore|Hugo]] main [[Hayao (gamer)|]] managed to execute an air parry against FrankieBFG's Ken, then narrowly avoiding Ken's spinning kick with a Standing Heavy Kick (which is widely considered the worst normal move in the game), and proceed to deal match-winning blow while living on the "magic pixel". Another notable moment within the match was when Hayao performed a [[split]] while playing the game.

h4. External links 
* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evolution_Championship_Series

title: akane_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. She is a covert agent of Millennium's [[Cleaning & Clearing (blue archive)|]] specializing in explosives. Goes by the callsign of Zero-Three (0-3). Her full name is [b]Murokasa Akane[/b].

Akane has a [[long hair|long]] [[light brown hair]] with [[hair between eyes|one large strand in the middle between her eyes]], and a pair of light [[brown eyes]] with [[glasses]]. She wears the [[long skirt]] version of her C&C [[maid|maid uniform]] with her trademark large [[brown shawl]] under her shoulders.

Akane's firearm is a modern version of the [[Welrod]] integrally-[[suppressor|suppressed]] [[handgun]].

Voiced by: [[Hara Yumi]]

title: burning_down_the_house_(stand)
body:
Burning Down the House is the [[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[Emporio Alnino]], featured in the sixth part of the [[JoJo No Kimyou Na Bouken]] series, [[Stone Ocean]].

It is a pure ability [[Stand (jojo)|]] that allows Emporio to interact with the ghosts of a room and the objects contained within.

Burning Down the House has no physical form; it instead materializes the ghost of a music room hidden behind an invisible crack on the wall of a staircase in Green Dolphin Street Prison. The room's most defining features are a grand piano complete with a seat standing at the center over a large carpet and a Lichtenstein print on the wall. The room also incorporates a chair and a small table on which lies a plate with a can and a glass of orange juice and a Mars chocolate bar. Other pieces of furniture include various drawers and shelving units which hold several books and miscellaneous objects.

Namesake: Burning Down the House (Talking Heads song)
other_names: バーニング・ダウン・ザ・ハウス

body: One of the senior nurses at the hospital, and sister to [[Tendou Mako]]. Uses third person pronouns.

title: tobiichi_origami
body:
[[Itsuka_Shido]]'s classmate. She shows extremely perverted tendencies towards Shido and speaks in a monotone voice. Part of the Anti-Spirit Team. Trained her entire life to try and kill the Spirit that killed her parents, joining the AST, and after a series of incidents, DEM to try to kill that spirit.

[spoiler]After joining DEM, she uses a new CR-Unit in battle only to lose. She wishes for more power and inadvertently becomes a Spirit herself. She travels back in time to try to kill the [[Takamiya_Mio|Spirit of Origin]], because she believes the Spirit of Origin killed her parents, but the killer was actually Origami herself. This is the reason for [[tobiichi_origami_(inverse)|Origami]] to [[reverse_spirit|invert]].  [/spoiler]

title: sunbeam
body:
[[Sunbeam]] or crepuscular rays are light rays that stream through gaps in clouds or between other objects. 

For tagging purposes, keep in mind that a particular image may satisfy one or more of the specific terms mentions above.

* [[Sunlight]] is the light that apparently or observably comes from the sun in the sky. (See post #5469) 
* [[Sunburst]] is for designs or figures of burst of [[sunlight]], but may not necessarily be the actual sun. (See post #645306)

title: skindentation
body:
Portmanteau of "skin indentation".

When clothes are so [[tight clothes|tight]] they indent into the skin and make the surrounding flesh bulge outwards. For example, tight [[thighhighs]] that cause the thighs to bulge over the top.

See [[deep skin]] for when skindentation is caused by groping instead of clothing.

See [[imprinted skin]] for the marks on skin caused by skindentation.

h4. Examples

* !post #6407327

title: pokemon_sv
body:
[b]Pokemon Scarlet and Violet[/b] are open-world [[pokemon|Pokémon]] games for [[Nintendo Switch]]. They are the first games of the ninth generation, released on November 18, 2022. The games take place in Paldea, a region based on Spain.

h4. Characters

h6. Protagonists

* [[Florian (pokemon)|]]
* [[Juliana (pokemon)|]]

h6. Friends and Rivals

* [[Nemona (pokemon)|]]
* [[Arven (pokemon)|]]
* [[Penny (pokemon)|]]

title: euphonia_(reverse:1999)
body:
A NPC that appears in the [[Reverse:1999]] x [[Assassin's Creed (Series)|]] crossover event during the [[Assassin's Creed: Odyssey]] part.

A Greek bard that plays a [[Lyre]], she is a friend of [[Kassandra of Sparta]] who admires her by singing and reciting poems of Kassandra's deeds of heroism much to the latter's annoyance.

title: ripened_tingle's_balloon_trip_of_love
body:
Irozuki Tingle no Koi no Balloon Trip is an adventure video game developed by Vanpool and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo DS. It is a sequel to the game [[Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland]] and was released in Japan on August 6, 2009. As with its predecessor, the game focuses on [[Tingle]], a character from [[The Legend of Zelda]] series.

An English fan translation patch for the game was released on January 1, 2018 after five years of development.

title: hillie_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she is a maid at [[Dawn Winery]] who is always seen talking to [[Moco (genshin impact)|]].

Her tendency to gossip with Moco often leaves head maid [[Adelinde (genshin impact)|]] less-than-pleased with their work.

Hillie has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a [[maid]] outfit consisting of a [[white dress|white]] and [[black dress|black]] [[two-tone dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[black corset]], a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], [[black pantyhose]], a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]], [[white gloves]] and has a [[maid headdress]] on her head.

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Hillie":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Hillie

title: moco_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she is a maid at [[Dawn Winery]] who is always seen talking to [[Hillie (genshin impact)|]].

Her tendency to gossip with Hillie often leaves head maid [[Adelinde (genshin impact)|]] less-than-pleased with their work.

Moco has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[maid]] outfit consisting of a [[white dress|white]] and [[black dress|black]] [[two-tone dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[black corset]], a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], [[black pantyhose]], a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]], [[white gloves]] and a [[maid headdress]] on her head.

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Moco":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Moco

title: adelinde_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she is the head housemaid at [[Dawn Winery]].

Adelinde worked at Dawn Winery when [[Crepus (genshin impact)|]] was still alive and often looked after [[Diluc (genshin impact)|]] and [[Kaeya (genshin impact)|]] when they were young, making her aware of the past history between them.

Adelinde has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[maid]] outfit consisting of a [[black dress]] with [[juliet sleeves]] and a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], [[white pantyhose]], a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]] and has a [[maid headdress]] on her head.

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Adelinde":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Adelinde

title: elzer_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], he helps [[Diluc (genshin impact)|]] manage [[Dawn Winery]] and is the executive chairman of the Mondstadt Wine Guild. 

Elzer also served Dawn Winery while [[Crepus (genshin impact)|]] was still alive and claims he was like a father to him. For that reason, he assumed most of the Winery's affairs after his death. He is also one of the few people that are aware Diluc is the "Darknight Hero".

Elzer has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears a [[brown jacket]] with [[short sleeves]] overtop a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] and a [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[black belt]], [[brown pants]] and a pair of [[purple boots]]. He also carries a [[sword]] and [[sheath]] by his left leg.

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Elzer":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Elzer

title: ellin_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she can be found behind the Knights of Favonius Headquarters in Mondstadt. 

Ellin wants to become a member of the Knights of Favonius and it's next Grandmaster. She greatly admires [[Jean (genshin impact)|]] and trains behind the knights' headquarter, practicing Jean's sword techniques.

Ellin has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]], [[blunt bangs]] and [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[neck ribbon]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[brown belt]], [[puffy shorts|puffy]] [[blue shorts|blue]] [[short shorts]], [[white socks]] and a pair of [[blue boots]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Ellin":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Ellin

title: huffman_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], he is a member of the Knights of Favonius who usually conducts safety patrols or restocks and dispenses [[medicine]]. He is also a member of the [[Barbara (genshin impact)|]] Fan Club and has even received her autograph. He is the older brother of [[Mika (genshin impact)|]].

Huffman has [[short hair|short]] [[parted hair|parted]] [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears the standard Knights of Favonius uniform, consisting of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black shirt]], [[black gloves]], [[vambraces]], [[pauldrons]], a [[breastplate]], a [[brown belt]], [[black pants]], a [[thigh strap]] on his left leg and a pair of [[armored boots|armored]] [[knee boots]]. He also carries a [[sword]] and [[sheath]] by his left leg.

h4. See also

* [[Knight of Favonius (genshin impact)|]]
* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Huffman":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Huffman
